What We Do
Unioncrate enables CPG companies to build and manage a supply chain that is driven by consumer demand. If you want to be part of building a next-generation supply chain platform and help control how goods move around the world then this is the position for you!
Who We’re Looking For
We are growing and looking for a data engineer to join our data science team! This role is ideal for someone with some back end development experience looking to work more closely with data.
What You’ll Do
As a data engineer, you will provide input into architectural design decision, develop code to meet business needs and ensure the applications built are meeting high standards of quality and support-ability. This position will be part of the data science team and will require high collaboration within and across the different Unioncrate teams.
Primary Responsibilities
Collaborate with the different teams to normalize client data to Unioncrate standards
Write Python code to improve and optimize complex ETL process for batch data processing from a variety of SQL and non-SQL data sources
Take loosely-defined business questions and translate them into clearly-defined technical/data specifications for implementation
Ensure that data pipelines are scalable, repeatable and secure
Add to our portfolio of client libraries that interface with 3rd party API’s
Assist the Data Science team in optimizing newly developed algorithms
Work with the Cloud Engineering team to improve our current deployment process
Ensure all deliverables and processes are of high-quality throughout the project by adhering to best practices
Mentor less experienced members of the team
Qualifications / Requirements
2-3 years of hands-on experience designing and implementing large-scale, complex ETL applications using industry-leading products/platforms
2-3 years of experience using SQL to perform complex data manipulation
1+ year experience with Python
Ability to deal with ambiguity and work with rapidly-changing business data
Team player, great communicator, collaborative and optimistic by nature
Comfortable working in a startup environment with remote colleagues across the globe
Familiarity with common programming tools and best practices such as unit testing, Git, and Jira
This position is for the New York City Office
Nice-to-haves
Exposure to time series data / signal processing
Experience writing client API libraries
Experience working with Docker containers
Experience working with functional programming paradigms
Experience in any of the more popular Clouds (Azure, AWS or GCP)
Interested? Email us a PDF of your resume at careers@unioncrate.com.

Description
About this role
Aladdin Wealth Tech - Product – Data Insights & Analytics – VP, Data Science
Business Unit Overview:
BlackRock Solutions (BRS) is uniquely positioned to address the industry’s risk management, portfolio construction and financial technology demands. The various business departments within BRS are focused on providing clients with highly scalable portfolio analytics & risk management, liability-driven investing & pension solutions, and regulatory advice & balance sheet strategy. BRS offers clients customized solutions powered by Aladdin, BlackRock’s proprietary risk management system.
The Aladdin Wealth team within BRS leverages the same risk analytics used by $17 trillion of Institutional assets to equip wealth management clients with model construction capabilities, risk monitoring tools, and portfolio construction & analytics. Aladdin Wealth partners with clients to help them oversee their enterprise risk, building better portfolios, enhancing their value proposition and institutionalizing their investment process.
Position Description:
The Aladdin Wealth business is effectively a start up with the broad reach of BlackRock and Aladdin. We are seeking for a data scientist who will conduct research on data-driven solutions for business problems and insights. This role will work on all aspects of data insights and analytics projects from problem formulation to productionize solutions in a scalable way. The successful candidate will take a responsibility to actively bring new innovative ideas to the team with data science techniques to drive client engagement and adoption while understanding the needs of our clients as well as striving to explore and learn from the changes in landscape of wealth management industry.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop innovative solutions with large data sets for solving business challenges and developing business insights
Create new data insights and analytics using data science techniques to drive client engagement and adoption
Implement and optimize the existing process to become more scalable and efficient through data science
Perform portfolio exposure analysis, risk and performance analysis to bring insights to clients through visualization, stories, and interpretable summaries
Identify and automate manual work with data science techniques
Skills and Qualifications:
MS in quantitative or technical field
Strong problem solving / analytical skills are required
Strong proficiency in statistical programming languages such as Python and R
Familiarity with numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow/Keras, NLTK/spaCy
Must be a self-starter with the ability to both collaborate and work independently
Excellent communication skills in both written and verbal
Experience in text mining and analytics is a plus
Experience with unstructured data wrangling, cleaning, and sampling is a plus
Previous experience with portfolio analytics (risk, performance) is a plus
Knowledge in risk model methodology is a plus
Knowledge in Wealth Management Industry is a strong plus
Our benefits

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.
About BlackRock
At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.
This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.
BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.
BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

About Klarna
Klarna was founded in Stockholm, Sweden in 2005. Since then we've changed the banking industry forever. And now we're creating the world's smoothest shopping experience. We serve over 90 million consumers worldwide, and partner with 250,000 merchants – with a new merchant joining us every 8 minutes. Including some of the world's leading brands, such as H&M, ASOS, IKEA, Adidas, Samsung and Lufthansa. Our offices are spread over 17 different markets, hosted by 5000+ employees from 100+ nationalities.

Who you are:
We are looking for an Analytics Manager to join our rapidly expanding US Credit Innovation & Underwriting teams. You have extensive experience designing credit policy on consumer lending products, executing resilient credit growth initiatives, and identifying ways to split risk using non-traditional data sources. You are passionate about identifying, solving, and scoping out solutions to complex business problems using both data and judgment. You thrive with the responsibility of owning projects end-to-end and working cross-functionally with other business groups to bring solutions to market. Although you may not have managed analysts in your past roles, you enjoy mentoring junior teammates and sharing with them your best-practice analytical frameworks. You enjoy working in the fast pace of a high-growth, innovative, fintech. You are enthusiastic about challenging the status quo to deliver best-in-class experiences and products for customers.
What you will do:
As a member of the US Credit Innovation & Underwriting teams, you will be responsible for catapulting Klarna’s Pay-in-Four (Pi4) and Financing products to the cutting edge of risk decision making. You will collaborate closely with Modeling, Product, and Commercial teams across Stockholm, Berlin, and New York to cement Klarna as the US’s favorite way to shop and pay. US Credit Innovation & Underwriting is a US-based team whose success is defined as meeting growth and profitability goals across US products.
Responsibilities:
Own the risk performance of Klarna’s US products, making efficient credit policy decisions to steer the product towards growth goals within the established risk appetite
Run a world-class lending program through implementation of credit best practices, including controls, monitoring, and testing protocols
Collaborate with Commercial and Product teams to create products that solve the needs of Merchant Partners to get their items into the hands of consumers
Collaborate with Data Science teams to generate best-in-class risk detection models
Research, test, and implement alternative data solutions to increase coverage of “credit invisible” populations and improve customer affordability assessments
Design line assignment testing strategy to optimize spending limit framework for consumer spend and risk
Reimagine credit policy architecture to optimize stakeholder transparency and speed of response to emerging credit trends
Generate synergies for Klarna’s global product offering through collaboration with credit teams from other Klarna markets
What we look for:
Prior Experience: 5-10 years of background from consulting, investment banking, fintech/payments company, retail e-commerce or other high growth organization with operational experience in a quantitative or analytical role
Attitude: Positive, solution-oriented growth mindset. Hunger to take ownership of business problems and drive your personal development
Problem Solving Skills: The ability to identify and isolate trends and connect them to customer behavioral patterns and business impacts
Data Analytics Skills: Proficiency in pulling data and performing analysis in SQL, Python, or R.
Communication Skills: Ability to effectively communicate actionable data-driven insights to audiences of all levels.
Project Management Skills: Ability to define destination state, assess current state, and deliver a plan to close the gap. Experience defining key milestones/KPIs and managing stakeholder relationships, including through demos and communications
Klarna is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates. Please refrain from including your picture and age with your application.

Company Overview

Graphika’s mission is to map the world’s social media networks, so that online spaces can thrive authentically. We create large-scale, in-depth maps of social media landscapes and conversations to help businesses discover how communities form online and how influence and information flows within large scale networks. Founded on the pioneering work of social and network science scholars, Graphika uses deep learning to identify the people, connections, messages, and conversations online that matter for customers from Facebook and Twitter, to T-Systems and ABinBev. Our interdisciplinary team uses our unique, patented set of technologies and tools to create and apply new, rigorous analytical methods that enable customers to engage in online communities meaningfully to grasp opportunities or mitigate risk online. Our work has informed the U.S. Senate Select Committee on Intelligence on election interference.

About The Role

Graphika seeks a research scientist with experience in machine learning to join our applied science team. We work at the cutting edge of computational social science to develop new methods for network and narrative analysis, integrate those methods into our product, and share our results with the wider scientific community. As a research scientist, you will construct machine learning models to answer challenging social science questions on top of large social media datasets. You will work closely with our analyst team to develop models that support their discovery of insights and narratives (including disinformation narratives) in social systems. You will also work closely with our data systems team to construct pipelines for scaling and productizing these models. This is a part-time contractor or part-time or full-time employee role.

Areas of Responsibility
develop machine learning models for applications such automated cluster labeling, narrative extraction, and stance detection
implement machine learning models in robust, scalable code for further pipelining and productization
contribute to patent applications based on your work (you will be listed as a co-inventor on the resulting patents)
contribute to novel grant proposals in computational social science
collaborate with external researchers in the field on via funded grants and publications
Ideal Candidate Profile

You have experience developing machine learning models for social science applications, including but not limited to: social network analysis, natural language analysis, statistical or agent-based models of social systems. You have experience implementing these models in code in a collaborative environment, working with a team to optimize your code and adhere to best practices. You are comfortable applying your technical expertise to new domains. You love to take on complex problems, and can work independently. You have a working knowledge of computer science fundamentals like algorithms, data structures, and time complexity.

You think beyond the task at hand and try to understand the 'why' behind what you are doing. You can maintain a focus on the applied outcomes of your research, understanding that done is often preferable to perfect.

You are an enthusiastic teammate, who engages in collaboration and proactive discussion. You are an effective communicator who can clearly describe technical concepts for different audiences - for example, you can explain the significance of your work both to a fellow researcher and to a product specialist. You work with confidence and without ego. You have deep knowledge and exercise a high degree of ownership in your daily work. You have loosely-held, defensible ideas, and advocate for what you believe is right. You can surface your unarticulated assumptions. You are also adept at identifying and evaluating trade-offs, willing to be proven wrong, and quick to support your fellow teammates.

Qualifications

Required:

Experience in developing machine learning models in an applied, collaborative environment with actionable outputs
Experience writing robust scalable code in Python that is understandable, testable, and has an eye towards maintainability
Experience collaborating with a multidisciplinary team and juggling multiple research priorities
Experience generating research outputs (reports, scientific papers) from technical work
Ability to work legally in the US without visa sponsorship

Nice to have:

Experience with social science applications of machine learning models
Experience developing production engineering code in an industry environment
Experience with deep learning models
Experience with social network analysis
Experience contributing to scientific grant proposals
Experience working on patent applications
Ph.D. in a social science or computer science field
All Graphika Tech Team Members...
Understand and appreciate good software engineering practices, including version control, code reviews, testing, and refactoring
Are comfortable debugging and optimizing code
Write tests to make sure code is reliable
Help shape technical decisions within the team
Collaborate within and across departments to ensure successful product creation
Have the ability to pick up new tools and technologies as needed
Education Requirements:
Master's degree or equivalent work experience
Salary commensurate with experience
Benefits
Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO), with a company-mandated minimum of 10 days of vacation time taken per year; There are also a minimum of 12 Graphika holidays
100% healthcare (health, vision, dental) premium coverage for employees; 50% premium coverage for families
401(k)
Access to Samata Health Therapy Platform, with six free sessions for all Graphikans
Remote personal office setup stipend + 20% of home internet costs covered
Location

Prior to COVID-19, Graphika's technology team was mostly co-located in our NYC office but continues to be fully-distributed today. As a result, we are happy to consider applicants who are located in the continental US, with the caveat that the technology team works on Eastern time and begins their day at around 10 AM. Daily Standup is at 10:30 AM EST.

Graphika is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

As a Data Engineer at Productive Edge, you will be a member of a high-performing team delivering software solutions to clients. Your days will normally consist of the following activities:Provide technical analysis, design, development, and enhancement.Provide process, data and object modeling in a variety of application and database environments.Provide database design, development, and enhancement, as well as management and coordination of changes to existing applications.To excel in these daily activities, a Data Engineer at Productive Edge would make use of the following experience and skills:2+ years hands-on experience with object-oriented design and development in Java or C#/.NET, including strong working knowledge and experience with various architectural and design patterns.Strong understanding of building, orchestrating, and maintaining big data pipelines.Hands on experience writing complex SQL and working with relational databases.Hands on experience with Spark or Databricks, including leveraging streaming data & analytics.Hands on Cloud experience, preferably with Microsoft Azure.Successful completion of projects working in an Agile environment.Experience working effectively with offshore developers.Experienced in problem-solving, and able to follow a methodical implementation process.Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, ability to handle diverse situations, multiple projects, and rapidly changing priorities.Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent work experience.Knowledge or experience with NoSQL databases is a plus.Knowledge or experience with Machine Learning is a plus!About Productive EdgeProductive Edge is a Chicago-based leader in digital transformation. As digital business consultants, we focus on digital strategy, customer experience, operations improvement, and product & services enablement. How do we do this? Through launching solutions for Data and Artificial Intelligence (AI), Intelligent Automation (IA), Internet of Things (IoT), and Cloud Native Solutions. Sounds fun, right? It gets better...and that’s where you come in!Productive Edge offers the dynamic opportunity to use your talents in a progressive, highly-collaborative environment that values innovation and creativity. We are a culture that stays on the cusp of today’s developing and emerging technologies. Our passion, ingenuity, and dedication sets us apart from other consultants (as does our modern work atmosphere with fun outings, foosball, stocked fridge and other activities). Because we work with and develop solutions for some of the world’s most exciting brands, we are actively searching for individuals who are ready to change the way the world operates.And if that’s not enough, Productive Edge has been featured as one of Chicago’s 101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For, included in Crain’s Fast 50, and is a regular on Inc. 5000.Job Type: Full-time

Why Hearst Magazines?
Hearst Magazines is one of the largest publishers in the world, with more than 25 brands, including Cosmopolitan, ELLE, Esquire, Good Housekeeping, Harper’s BAZAAR, Popular Mechanics, and O the Oprah Magazine. We reach more than 150 million people every month in the United States alone.But we’re more than just our magazines. We engage our audience across all mediums and channels - print, digital, video and social – with sophisticated content creation, distribution and data capabilities. We create, package and sell products with cutting-edge technology and proprietary platforms. Together, we are reinventing publishing for the 21st century.
We're looking for an exceptional data scientist to build and maintain our warehouse and pipelines for both business intelligence as well as deploying models for our varied requirements. The best candidate will have a let's get it done attitude, the ability to learn about the business and to work with a variety of stakeholders. You have a growth mindset, and want to bring data fluency to your team. How you'll make an impact
What you’ll do
Translate business and functional requirements into robust, scalable, operable solutions with a flexible and adaptable data architecture
Implement data ingestion routines both real time and batch using best practices in data modeling and ETL/ELT processes
Design and implement data microservices to feed products, models, and services
Monitor and improve data warehouse and database performance
Collaborate with engineers to help adopt best practices in data system creation, data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Perform security assessments of the database systems and make required adjustments to eliminate database vulnerabilities
Use profiling tools, debugging logs, performance metrics, and other data sources to make code and application level improvements
Design easy-to-consume, unified data schemas by transforming and cleaning our data

Work with PMs to validate their hypotheses about our product
Pull data, build dashboards, and keep a watchful eye on the overall health of our marketplace
Promote data fluency across the team
Develop interesting insights to drive data-driven content marketing
Who you are
You have 2+ years experience in data engineering with large scale datasets. Ideally at a startup or mid-size tech company
You have 1+ years experience backend engineering
You’re experienced with AWS (EC2, EMR, RDS), PostgreSQL, MongoDB
You are proficient in Node.js, SQL, and MQL
You are proficient in database modeling, designing efficient data structures and database schemas
You are proficient with data wrangling to answer analytical questions
You are proficient in database performance analysis and tuning
You’re experienced with operating high-availability systems
You understand best practices and methods for quantitative and qualitative testing
You have experience building, integrating, and maintaining data pipelines and machine learning models
You are highly skilled at SQL
You have a deep understanding of the internals of database and storage systems
You have coding experience in at least one of {Python, Ruby, Perl, R, Matlab}
You’re familiar with statistical models and analysis methods
You’ve proven to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
You have a degree in computer science or equivalent a plus
You have strong verbal and communication skills; ability to paint a compelling narrative with data

JobTitle: AI/ML - Machine Learning Researcher, Information Intelligenc...
Content_text:
Summary
Posted: Oct 26, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200305777
We are a group of engineers and researchers responsible for information intelligence at Apple. We build systems to connect Apple users to information in products ranging from search and Siri to on-device intelligence. We are looking for researchers who are passionate about developing algorithms, techniques, and systems that delight millions of users in Apple products and in the process push the frontier of deep learning.
Key Qualifications
Demonstrated expertise in deep learning with publication record in relevant conferences (e.g., NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, KDD, ACL, ICASSP, InterSpeech) or a track record in applying deep learning techniques to products
Proficient programming skills in Python and one of the deep learning toolkits such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, or Jax
Ability to work in a collaborative environment.
Description
We believe that the most interesting problems in deep learning research arise when we try to apply learning to real-world use cases, and this is also where the most important breakthroughs come from. You will work with a close-knit and fast growing team of world-class engineers and scientists to tackle some of the most challenging problems in deep learning and information intelligence, including natural language processing, multi-modal understanding, and combining learning with knowledge. Example applications include (but are not limited to) - Web-scale information retrieval - Human-like conversation agent - Multi-modal perception for existing products and future hardware platforms - On-device intelligence and learning with strong privacy protections Further, you will have opportunities to identify and develop novel applications of deep learning in Apple products. You will see you ideas not only published in papers, but also improve the experience of millions of users.
Education & Experience
PhD, or equivalent practical experience, in Computer Science, or related technical field
Additional Requirements
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace.

JobTitle: newVice President, Analytics Strategy and Transformation
Content_text:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Job Title
Vice President, Analytics Strategy and Transformation
Job Title

Vice President, Analytics Strategy and Transformation


Reporting to the Head of Technology Strategy and Transformation, the Vice President, Analytics Strategy and Transformation is responsible for developing the Analytics Strategy and owning and driving the related execution of Mastercard priorities, including working closely senior stakeholders, corporate leaders, and subject matter experts across Mastercard. This role leads the internal value creation from analytics and data science through (a) strategy definition, project intake, and project planning, (b) agile analytics execution and (c) value capture, business execution, and solution scaling. Furthermore, it is upon the Vice President to ensure the use of world-class technology-based systems and processes to guarantee solutions deliver efficient, secure, and effective experiences.


The Role


1/ Accelerating the analytics transformation of Mastercard as a leading technology company together with the O&T leadership team

Developing and leading initiatives across Mastercard that will allow moving towards operating like a leading technology and analytics company
Building strategic communications assets and change management practices to support the ongoing analytics transformation and enable Mastercard to operate as a leading technology company
Leading change management with teams and stakeholders to help them adopt more technology and analytics forward practices and behaviors
Getting called upon to represent Mastercard at external events, contributing to expert panels and sharing best practices

2/ Driving the internal analytics transformation by leading analytics strategy and prioritization

Leading the development, formulation and communication around analytics strategies and objectives
Partnering with business, program, and analytics leaders to identify, scope, and prioritize high impact analytics use cases, and creating and implementing the strategy, roadmap, resourcing and business cases to drive and deliver these use cases
Developing ongoing project intake and backlog prioritization practices to ensure transparency, stakeholder buy-in, and continuous delivery
Identifying needs and opportunities to augment Mastercard’s analytics capabilities with leading-edge analytics tools
Coordinating closely with O&T leaders to drive alignment and dependencies between different priorities

3/ Standing up a best-in-class analytics operating model and organization to capture value at scale

Supporting and driving the use of leading practices to scale analytics value capture initiatives spanning different teams, stakeholders, and geographies
Augmenting existing teams and standing up new resources to support model delivery and MLOps, analytics strategy and project management, and analytics value capture
Leading the development and sharing of best practices and knowledge that build on the MasterCard’s abilities to proactively address risks and priorities
Partnering with business leaders to design, evaluate and advance new operating model, ensuring alignment with corporate strategy

All about you


Extensive experience using data and analytics to answer complex business questions and develop
practical solutions.

Proven track record of influencing cross-functional teams to deliver measurable business impact.
Familiarity with large data sets, statistical analyses, and visualization as well as related tools.
Experience partnering with technology and business stakeholders to deliver analytical capabilities.
Results-proven track record of exceeding goals and a bottom-line orientation; evidence of the ability to consistently make good decisions through a combination of analysis, experience and judgment
Experience from working with leading global Technology and FinTech organizations
Deep understanding of world leading agile and technology business management practices
Demonstrated ability to balance the delivery of projects against the realities of a budget; and problem solving, project management and creative resourcefulness
Politically savvy collaborator and consensus builder with a track record of bringing people together around a common cause
Experience in the payments domain preferred
Ability to connect both on an individual level and in large groups; capacity to enforce accountability, cultivate entrepreneurship and learn the strengths and weaknesses of the team to put people in a position to succeed
Success evaluating complex strategic initiatives, facilitating, influencing and contributing to design and advancement
Demonstrated experience as a leader with the ability to attract, recruit, and develop technical talent
Commitment to diversity and ethical, accountable, and transparent leadership
Experience in personnel, budget, risk, and resource management
Highly developed presentation, facilitation, and communication skills (both verbal and written)
Bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science or engineering or equivalent work or education-related experience. Master of Business Administration or other advanced degree strongly preferred

Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.

Corporate Security Responsibility

Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and therefore, it is expected that the successful candidate for this position must:

JobTitle: Data & Analytics Manager, Deloitte Health Equity Institute,...
Content_text:
Data & Analytics Manager, Deloitte Health Equity Institute, Center for Health Solutions, Deloitte Services LP

Background:

Deloitte has launched a new social innovation organization called the Deloitte Health Equity Institute (DHEI). DHEI is a data-driven pro bono services, philanthropic, and knowledge development hub within Deloitte's Center for Health Solutions. DHEI draws on Deloitte's array of capabilities to activate health equity across the United States, helping to realize our firm's Purpose by moving the field for public good and advancing equitable health outcomes at scale.

To achieve our aspiration, DHEI is focused on addressing three root causes that prevent equitable health outcomes: 1) Racism and bias inside and outside the health care system, 2) Deep inequities in non-medical Drivers of Health, and 3) Structural flaws in the health system. To drive change across the three root causes, DHEI is focused on activating key decision makers to accelerate change, strengthening local ecosystems to advance equitable communities, and driving health equity innovation and learning across the US.

Position:

The Data & Analytics Manager is responsible for overseeing DHEI's data and analytics strategy, with an emphasis on applying ethical data science principles to enhance Deloitte's analytical tools to advance health equity and to generate the most effective analytical conclusions. In the role, the Data Manager will shape DHEI's data and analytics approach, apply their expertise in data science to strengthen and refine Deloitte's array of existing analytical tools to advance health equity, derive analytics-driven insights to address community challenges and support pro bono engagements related to health equity and manage a team of off-shore data scientists to deliver on engagement needs.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead all efforts related to data science and analytics within DHEI
Lead development and execution of strategic plans, in collaboration with DHEI's Executive Director and team members, to use advanced analytics to drive toward health equity
Work closely with Deloitte's engineering, business, and product development teams to evaluate use cases for fit with existing and new AI and advanced analytics algorithms in a way that advances health equity and that is motivated by equity-inspired principles
Work across multiple tools / analytical solutions to ensure that ethical and equity-based principles are applied consistently and effectively
Guide/shape/advise on product requirements and roadmaps for analytical tools
Serve as data science expert among team members and stakeholders, helping to identify optimal ways to apply data science expertise to existing and new solutions
Ensure quality, timely, and impactful data and insights are reported by DHEI
Execute ongoing project management to support in-flight programs and existing assets
Support the discovery of insights and identify opportunities to apply data science principles to improve health equity
Evaluate data quality and promote data governance best practices, including confirming that data assets are monitored, and governance principles are upheld
Drive internal alignment on data and analytics strategy, including dynamically assessing opportunities to apply data and analytics to support DHEI's goals with institute team members
Apply data and analytics to support DHEI grantees and partners in health equity-focused initiatives
This role is evolving, and opportunities to expand responsibilities and take on more challenging tasks will be readily available. A high degree of flexibility and ability to handle ambiguity and changing priorities are required.

Qualifications:

6+ years of professional experience, focused on Data Strategy, Product Management, and Business Transformation.
Track record of high performance; consultative and strategic mindset; ability to navigate ambiguous circumstances and complex structures
Commitment to bring an active anti-racist perspective and DEI (diversity, equity, and inclusion) lens
Commitment to applying data science principles in a way that accounts for equity-driven considerations and that maximizes the trustworthiness of the solutions developed
Exceptional working skillset in data-science and the development of predictive and AI/ML-based analytics
Understanding of health equity, social determinants of health, and health outcomes
Operational knowledge of population health analytics principles, biostatistics, and predictive and machine learning analytics
Strong analytical, research and project management skills
Strong ability to communicate strategy to an executive audience and external stakeholders
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Ability to prioritize activities and manage to aggressive deliverable due dates and workplan
Proven leadership, teaming skills, and stakeholder management skills
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Job Location:

Open - any US
