Are you seeking opportunities at the intersection of large-scale language technologies and responsible AI? Do you want to be a member of an interdisciplinary team of researchers, data & applied scientists, and software engineers? Do you embrace complex sociotechnical challenges? Microsoft Research is looking to hire an applied scientist for a new initiative on the fairness of large-scale language technologies, including large-scale language models such as Microsoft’s Turing models or OpenAI’s GPT-3. As a contributor to this initiative, you’ll conduct “deep dives” in partnership with Microsoft product teams who wish to be proactive and strategic about identifying, measuring, or mitigating potential fairness-related harms caused by large-scale language technologies (e.g, stereotyping, demeaning, or erasing groups of people). Successful candidates will have experience working with language technologies and will be passionate about prioritizing diversity, inclusion, and fairness.
We have locations in New York, NY; Redmond, WA; Montreal, QC; Cambridge, MA; and Cambridge, UK.
#Research
Responsibilities
You’ll be a member of an interdisciplinary team of world experts on the fairness of AI systems.
Your work will reflect the understanding that fairness a sociotechnical challenge.
You’ll collaborate with Microsoft product teams on identifying, measuring, or mitigating fairness-related harms caused by large-scale language technologies. You’ll work with them to develop and use methods that are appropriate for their systems, use cases, and deployment contexts.
You’ll package your work into practices and resources that other teams can use.
You’ll learn new skills and apply them as needed: You might be asked to learn about a new fairness measurement method from a research paper and implement it. Or you might be asked to prepare a case study and Jupyter notebook that walks practitioners through the process of mitigating fairness-related harms caused by large-scale language technologies.
You’ll work with stakeholders with a variety of backgrounds: some technical, some non-technical.
You’ll present your work to internal and external stakeholders, including Microsoft leadership.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, linguistics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
1-2 years of experience working with language technologies. This can include product experience, industry research, open-source contributions, or academic research (but not coursework).
Experience putting responsible AI principles (e.g., fairness, transparency) into practice.
Familiarity with recent advances in natural language processing and machine learning.
Coding skills in a general-purpose coding language (e.g., Python, Java, Scala, C#, or C/C++).
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree or PhD in computer science, linguistics, or a related field.
Good communication (including writing) skills that demonstrate the ability to keep teammates and other stakeholders (e.g., product teams, leadership, customers, users) informed.
Experience working at the intersection of large-scale language technologies and fairness.
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks and transformer-based language models.
Experience working productively on an interdisciplinary team spanning multiple roles.
Experience working with stakeholders with a variety of technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Ability to learn independently in new domains, including by reading academic papers.
Ability to work independently and ramp-up quickly on complex and unfamiliar codebases.
Strong intellectual curiosity and passion for tackling real-world challenges.
Track record of prioritizing diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Overview: The VP will lead the implementation of analytics services, data activations, and BI solutions in support of Active’s internal media teams, partner agencies, and end clients. This role will be responsible for identifying solutions that can improve our overall offering resulting in higher returns and cost savings through process efficiency improvements. Active is a dynamic company that is evolving with the ever-changing media landscape, the VP of Media Analytics will help teams find value in an immense amount of available data from media platforms, research partners, deterministic data partners, and internal financial systems.Reporting to the EVP of analytics who oversees Active and its US subsidiaries, Broadbeam Media and Involved media, the VP of analytics will join a team of 10 as the lead for Active US analytics. This new position is the result of an in-depth assessment of company needs and opportunities conducted in 2021. Guided by the assessment outcomes and their prior experience, the VP will work to build-out or improve capabilities in forecasting, media targeting, media performance analytics, digital media yield optimization, and business intelligence solutions.The VP will be supported by a newly formed media data operations team responsible for the build-out of an in-house data lake and data ETL platform. In addition, the VP will work closely with IT and media platform teams and help oversee investments with Tableau, Datorama, Power BI, and leading providers of media research data including Nielsen and Inscape ACR.Responsibilities: Media ROI - Analytics capabilities development & innovation leadership: The VP will lead the development of new analytics capabilities across the Active US media teams. With support from the existing analytics and data ops teams, input from the 2021 assessment, and collaboration with the VP of CRM and other department leads, the VP of Analytics will be responsible for maintaining a roadmap that is prioritized against existing revenue and future potential. The roadmap will include new modeling approaches, opportunities for automation and process improvements, data activations, media platform integrations, and ongoing projects.Insights Efficiency & Enablement – Active is focused on enabling modern media solutions with data and technology. The VP of Analytics will seek out and implement new ways to enable internal teams with the information the need to improve reach efficiency and yield.Data Strategy & BI Portfolio Optimization – The VP will be responsible for optimizing Active’s use of BI solutions including Tableau & Datorama. This includes understanding end user needs (internal and external clients), the available data, and applying industry best practices to improve the implementation of BI solutions.Forecast modeling / predictive analytics:  Guide the development of time series, econometric, and regression models to help predict audience outcomes from available inventories. The VP will work with internal teams and external consultants to calibrate in-house models built to assist with un-wired TV buying and local media buying for linear and OTT.Revenue and yield analytics:  The VP will be responsible for identifying opportunities to improve campaign returns for specific client buy parameters and goals while also looking for ways to optimize company yield across a portfolio of clients.Supervisory ResponsibilitiesThe VP will work with analysts and data scientists within the analytics team and have support from a data operations team dedicated to the Active media group.Qualifications: 10+ years in marketing analytics with a focus on reach media (linear TV, OTT, Radio, OOH, digital display & video). Proven track record of assessing opportunities and leading the build-out of new capabilities. At least 2-3 years of experience at a media agency is strongly preferred.Experience with traditional audience measurement methodologies for national and local linear TV.Experience with Tableau, Datorama, Power BI, and SalesforceExperience working with data lakes and or data management platforms as they relate to planning, executing, and measuring mediaExcellent communication and client relationship skills with a proven history of building and maintaining client relationships. Experience building and leading a team of analysts.Excellent data science skills including forecasting techniques, MMM / MTA, machine learning basic programming.The ability to translate results into clear presentations, written reports, and data visualizationsKnowledge of multiple media types including:  linear TV, OTT / CTV, SEM, SEO, social paid, social earned / owned, display, radio.Strong knowledge of media trends including emerging channels and innovations. A tendency to stay tuned-in to the most recent developments through research and networking.Resourceful and creative — must bring fresh insights and not be discouraged when all the data is not readily availableHighly skilled in accessing and manipulating data from relational databases (SQL, Python)Highly skilled in a statistical software package (R, SPSS, SAS)Experience with ACR data is preferredExperience with BI tools including Tableau & DatoramaExperience with identity resolution partners:  Liveramp, FullContactExperience with javascript tagging, pixel tagsTravelThis position requires occasional travel to client locations when current public health conditions improve.Location: One Blue Hill Plaza, Pearl River, NY 10965Job Type: Full-time

Hands-on proficiency in design and coding Core Python
Data Visualization
Data Analysis
Data Wrangling and Data cleaning
Use of Python packages E.g. (NumPy, MatPlotlib, Scikit learn, etc) for Data Science.
Good SQL Knowledge

Thrasio is the consumer goods company reimagining omnichannel commerce and consumer products, and boasts an innovation engine that brings high-quality products to market across digital marketplaces, channels, and retailers globally.

With the experience of evaluating more than 6,000 Amazon companies, acquiring over 130 top-rated brands, and managing the scale of 22,000 products, Thrasio is the largest acquirer of Amazon FBA brands. Since our founding in 2018, the team has grown to more than 1,000 people globally-most of that growth has occurred during the COVID-19 pandemic. Hiring people who share a passion for their craft in the eCommerce space is the reason we’re projected to grow more than 10x in the next few years. This growth is supported by investors whose portfolios include Facebook, Google, Jet.com, StitchFix, and Lululemon. We do our best work when we’re surrounded by people who are insatiably curious, agile, and who thrive in collaborative, check-your-ego-at-the door working environments. Sound like you? We’d love to chat.
The Role:
Want to build something new and exciting? Do you like building tools that can answer what demand might look like 6 months out for a particular product?
The Technology Organization (Product, Engineering and Data Science) at Thrasio is responsible for building the internal tools that will help ensure data quality and create opportunity for our great people here to quickly access data and make decisions related to growth of our brands (soon to be thousands of products) as we continue our goal of being the number one seller on Amazon.
In this role, you will be at the center of all the decision support for the company as we use the latest ML/DL and data science techniques to continuously optimize every aspect of the business, including inventory management, forecasting, lead gen analysis, keyword optimization and a whole new category of decision management for day to day operations.
Key Responsibilities:
Owning the full Data Science life-cycle from conception to prototyping, testing, deploying, and measuring its overall business value
Developing quantitative models, leveraging machine learning and advanced data analysis techniques
Architecting and building technical platforms for our algorithmic engines to run at scale
Using data to improve the decision-making of everyone at Thrasio, and ultimately, to enhance the experience of our customers and our suppliers
Serving as a consultative partner to the marketing and creative teams to understand needs and conduct analyses that will help determine targeting strategy
Provide technical leadership and strategic initiatives for your team
Deliver presentations to high level business stakeholders that tell cohesive, logical stories using data - while this is primarily a technical role, we value the communication of ideas and want to expose data science to the company at large.
 What you bring to the party:
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or Computer Science or technical equivalent and 8+ years of experience in data science type roles
Highly proficient in Python and SQL programming
Machine Learning experience: supervised/unsupervised learning, recommendation systems, reinforcement learning, deep learning, time series etc.; Prophet, arima, deepar, lstms, RL or ranking work is a plus
Ability to effectively work with business leads: strong communication skills, ability to synthesize conclusions for non-experts and desire to influence business decisions
Intuitive sense of how quantitative and technical work aligns closely with business priorities and business value
Be really excited with the idea of building something new, for a business tackling e-commerce in an entirely different way
Nice to have, but not required:
Master's Degree or PhD in a quantitative field, e.g. Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Neuroscience, Operations Research, etc.
Product Ecommerce experience
THRASIO IS PROUD TO BE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER AND CONSIDERS ALL QUALIFIED APPLICANTS FOR EMPLOYMENT WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, SEX, GENDER, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY, ANCESTRY, AGE, OR NATIONAL ORIGIN. FURTHER, QUALIFIED APPLICANTS WILL NOT BE DISCRIMINATED AGAINST ON THE BASIS OF DISABILITY, PROTECTED CLASSES, OR PROTECTED VETERAN STATUS. THRASIO PARTICIPATES IN E-VERIFY.

Thrasio does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Thrasio employees or any other organization location. Thrasio is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

When you join Verizon
Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.
What you’ll be doing...
Verizon New Business Incubation (NBI) is looking for a Chief Applied Scientist to help us develop and deliver cutting edge automation technologies to our customers via our industry leading 5G network. Reporting directly to the CTO of NBI, you will lead the development of our machine learning and artificial intelligence capabilities designed to advance a variety of initiatives - from mobile robot autonomy and Edge AI, to cybersecurity. We are looking for a technical innovator with strong product instincts and a collaborative, empathetic approach to their work. You will have an intimate understanding of reinforcement learning, self-supervised learning, synthetic data generation, and be comfortable working with the CTO to execute a business-oriented technology strategy that drives customer satisfaction and enables exponential revenue growth.
Work with technical and business leadership to gain a detailed understanding of our target markets, key revenue opportunities, and upcoming products.
Work with our customers to gain an extremely detailed understanding of their standard operating procedures and business processes.
Leverage the above understanding to design automation strategies, developing and training the AI/ML capabilities necessary to insert autonomous and stationary robots into existing workflows.
Provide technical leadership of R&D projects, working with R&D engineers to define, capture, and execute development programs that generate novel, state-of-the-art algorithms and solutions for applied use cases.
Hire, grow, and manage a team of applied scientists, guiding their customer-centric work and methods with an eye on cross-utilization between customers, industries, and problem sets.
What we’re looking for...
Our Chief Applied Scientist should have a strong background in the area of mathematics-based machine learning. Candidates are expected to come with demonstrated capabilities on probabilistic methods, including, but not limited to, non-parametric Bayesian networks, convolutional neural networks, compact probabilistic representation, multimodal deep belief networks, detection, autonomous heterogeneous sensor networks, and reinforcement transfer and one-shot learning methods.
You'll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
Even better if you have one or more of the following:
MS (PhD preferred) with six or more years of multidisciplinary professional research experience.
Specialization in deep supervised and/or deep reinforcement learning.
Experience as the technical, hands-on principal investigator for mathematics-based machine learning R&D programs.
Experience as the technical lead on new business acquisition initiatives.
Strong technical writing and verbal presentation skills.
Established track record of developing a technical research strategy that drives AI/ML development for R&D groups.
A relationship-driven workstyle with a dedication to interdisciplinary collaboration and strong commitment to mentoring less senior staff and colleagues.
Publication in refereed technical journals.
Five or more years of experience working with Edge AI, reinforcement, active, and supervised learning, as applied to both stationary and autonomous robots.
Five or more years of experience working with IoT and computer vision platforms, with expertise designing, training, and deploying novel deep learning architectures and a broad understanding of DL methods and literature.
Strong development experience in languages like C++ and Python, as well as frameworks like Tensorflow, PyTorch, Kuda, and/or Keras.
Understanding of the limitations of algorithms and data, with a creative approach for overcoming those limitations to close gaps and solve problems.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
Verizon requires new hires to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Verizon provides reasonable accommodations consistent with legal requirements (e.g., for medical or religious reasons).

THE ROLE:
The Senior Supply Chain data analyst is responsible for utilizing multi-source data and analytics tools to drive actionable insights across Supply Chain planning. This role requires a deep understanding of end-to-end supply chain, key operational metrics and an ability to use data to create supporting dashboards and reports. Translate complex data or algorithms into conclusions that will support and influence key decisions within our forecasting and planning functions. This person will be an expert in Excel, SQL, R, Python with a deep understanding of Tableau. 3-4 years of experience building out dashboards, metrics, KPIs with an ability to present the data in a clear and concise manner to cross-functional and managerial teams.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Deep understanding of end-to-end supply chain and industry KPIs to manage performance
Ability to quickly understand, validate and map complex back-end data tables
Ability to communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to understand different data streams and potential gaps
Formulate and deliver Supply Chain analytic insights across various operational functions - Demand/Supply planning, logistics, procurement, inventory management, finance
Ability to find practical solutions around data problems and data gaps
Capture organizational knowledge related to data and document processes/solutions
Create and present actionable insights to senior management
Build out highly interactive, customizable, and impactful tableau dashboards


QUALIFICATIONS:

5+ years of experience in Supply Chain, Data engineering, Operation research or Analytics
Advance knowledge of database and visualization platforms (Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, SQL, Python), and Excel.
Knowledge of operational supply chain including procurement and logistic flow, warehousing, distribution, inventory planning
Strong process improvement and problem-solving experience using complex data models
Ability to thrive in fast-paced, entrepreneurial, lean environment
Strong Bias for action with experience delivering in ambiguous environments
Experience with ERP, Netsuite, E2open, and other Advance Planning tools preferred
Strong verbal and written communication
ABOUT PELOTON:

Peloton uses technology + design to connect the world through fitness, empowering people to be the best version of themselves anywhere, anytime. We have reinvented the fitness industry by developing a first-of-its-kind subscription platform. Seamlessly combining hardware, software, and streaming technology, we create digital fitness and wellness content and products that Members love. In 2020 Peloton committed to becoming an antiracist organization with the launch of the Peloton Pledge. Learn more, here.

"Together We Go Far" means that we are greater than the sum of our parts, stronger collectively when each one of us is at our best. In order to be the best version of Peloton, we are deeply committed to building a diverse workforce and inclusive culture where all of our team members can be the best version of themselves. This work has no endpoint; it is the constant work of running an organization that strives to reach its full potential. As a first step in our commitment, we announced the Peloton Pledge to invest $100 million over the next four years to fight racial injustice and inequity in our world, and to promote health and wellbeing for all, from the inside out.

Peloton is an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our applicants. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you would like to request any accommodations from application through to interview, please email: applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com


Please be aware that fictitious job openings, consulting engagements, solicitations, or employment offers may be circulated on the Internet in an attempt to obtain privileged information, or to induce you to pay a fee for services related to recruitment or training. Peloton does NOT charge any application, processing, or training fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process. All genuine job openings will be posted here on our careers page and all communications from the Peloton recruiting team and/or hiring managers will be from an @onepeloton.com email address.

If you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Peloton, please email applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.


Peloton does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Agencies should not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Peloton employees or any other organization location. Peloton is not responsible for any agency fees related to unsolicited resumes.

The Advanced Analytics team applies quantitative and algorithmic techniques across a broad spectrum of problem sets which inform planning and operations for Facebook’s global offices and facilities. Our team works within a larger Analytics & Technology-focused group to deliver innovative insights and solutions for our partners, we are looking for an analytics lead acting as a tech lead. The ideal candidate has an analytic mindset; has expertise in analytical methods and data storytelling; applies a pragmatic approach to addressing business problems; and enjoys collaborating within a dynamic, global team.


Apply your skills in data analysis, modeling, and storytelling using tools such as Python, R, Presto, SQL, and Tableau to address problems and derive actionable insights in areas such as Facility Design, Facility Operations, Space Planning, Culinary, and/or Transportation
Collaborate directly with stakeholders and build understanding of their business processes and goals to identify and propose opportunities to leverage data science & analytical methods
Communicate findings to stakeholders and leadership teams with clear summaries and recommendations to inform next steps
Manage work with minimal supervision and deliver according to business or project needs: proactively provide visibility on progress and track new requests by leveraging internal project management and development tools, escalating blockers with team and project leads as necessary
Promote impactful and holistic solutions by collaborating with members of the Analytics team and other technical partners on project planning, design, and execution


Degree in a field which emphasizes scientific thinking or equivalent experience in an analytical or quantitative role
At least 4 years of professional experience in a data science or analytics-related role
Experience identifying appropriate statistical and/or algorithmic approaches to address business problems
Communication skills, with experience communicating and summarizing results and findings for a nontechnical audience, leveraging tools such as Python, R, or Tableau as appropriate to build effective visualizations
Experience using Python or R for exploratory and/or statistical analysis & modeling
Experience writing SQL queries to extract and prepare data for modeling and analyses


Advanced degree in a quantitative field
Experience working with large structured or unstructured data
Experience designing experiments and measuring success of experiments


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.


Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

When you look at data, you see the storylines that lie within. You're fascinated by what can be discovered when you look at human behavior in aggregate. You love generating insights, finding the common threads and sharing your discoveries.You're looking for a new challenge. You're hungry to use your ability to manipulate data and tell stories in a setting with unique constraints. Above all, you want to make a real impact on more than just software interfaces – you want to help transform the way an entire industry does business.In this role, you'll be the source of truth in terms of how users interact with the VideoAmp platform. You'll work with teams across the organization – design, product, engineering, marketing – to ensure strategic product decisions are made with an accurate view of usage patterns and help the company measure the impact of development efforts..We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic User Experience Data Analyst who will be responsible for understanding how the world's largest agencies, advertisers and publishers use our products and services and providing our teams with the data they need to build solutions that will address the shifting needs in the evolving space of advertising technology. Our user experience research team is comprised of passionate problem solvers who look for unique methods to surface and evangelize insights. They are most effective at their jobs in a fast-paced environment, under internal and external pressure, and against the odds.Reporting to the Director of User Experience Research, you'll be responsible for combing through various data sets to identify usage trends across our products and services. You'll synthesize the insights you discover into impactful reports that will ensure product decisions are made with a realistic understanding of how the platform is being used.What you'll do: Measure and analyze platform usage data across multiple platformsSynthesize insights and communicate findings to drive strategic product decisionsGenerate recurring and one-off reports to define the success of development effortsDevise data gathering strategies and suggest improvements on how we can mine the insights that will drive decision makingFoster user experience improvements by working with stakeholders in product, design, engineering and marketingYou have experience: Working with cross-functional teams to help drive decisionsProducing impactful reports and presentations that turn raw data into actionable insightsSynthesizing data from multiple sources to inform experience strategy and business decisionsWorking under the unique constraints of a B2B product with a narrow user baseUsing tools like Excel, R or Python to perform and interpret statistical anlaysesRequired Skills: Bachelor's degree in a UX (human-computer interaction, human factors, behavioral research, or graphic design) or data analysis (e.g., data science, economics, social science) field or equivalent practical experience.3 years of experience as a qualitative researcher in the private sectorPERKS: Unlimited paid time off each yearCompany-sponsored health, dental and vision benefits for you and your dependentsAnnual vacation and childcare stipendsAccess to state-of-the-art fitness classes and personal trainers to promote your well-being. Live and recorded virtual workout classes every day + weekly yoga/pilates/wellness opportunitiesQuarterly fitness challengesWork from home set up provided1:1 Nutrition/Food program optionsPartnership with DoorDash for meal deliveriesWellness (Financial Wellness, Modern Health)Employee Advisory Groups / Proactive Social GroupsPet Funds + Pet Care Savings401k PlanEveryday discountsShort Term & Long Term DisabilityReferral BonusA progressive approach to paid parental leaveEpic personal and professional growth opportunitiesBOUT: The proliferation of streaming and digital media services has created the golden age of video entertainment with more premium TV content than ever before and we believe these experiences should be free or affordable to every human on the planet.Making this accessible to everyone usually requires subsidies from the advertising industry to power an effective three-way value exchange between a publisher producing content, a consumer viewing it and an advertiser paying the publisher for the chance to connect with its audience.While the ability to watch premium TV content on any device at any time is great for the consumer, the systems powering these services are fragmented, riddled with complexity and struggling to evolve in a changing privacy landscape. These systems are putting the entire ecosystem and three way value exchange at risk by providing an incomplete and siloed view of the audience that are responsible for advertising waste from inflated metrics, a decrease in publisher revenue opportunity from under-representing their audiences and consumers stuck with suboptimal viewing experiences.Today the industry standard tools are usually designed where connectivity and applications of consumer data sets often come with negative trade off for consumer privacy or security risks of leaking private data. We envision a world where this doesn't have to be the case - a world where consumer privacy, security, and governance are incorporated into the fabric of the codebase that interfaces with these systems to enable the necessary business use-cases that keep these viewing experiences free or affordable to everyone.The mission of VideoAmp is to be the independent software and data company creating a more sophisticated data-driven advertising ecosystem that redefines how media is valued, bought and sold. Our platform provides measurement and optimization tools that unifies audiences across the disparate systems of traditional TV, streaming video and digital media. We are unlocking new value for those that currently operate within a siloed view of their audiences, creating efficiencies for the entire industry. We are transforming a 100-year old industry by powering a more effective three-way value exchange that results in advertisers increasing their return on investment, publishers increasing their revenues and improving the viewing experience for consumers.Come and join us!Job Type: Full-time

Change.org is searching for two Senior Analysts to own dedicated analytics support to our product and campaign teams, using data as the primary tool for influencing decisions.

We're a social impact business (a public benefit company), and the world's largest non-profit owned tech platform focused on civic action with 80m monthly users, 50,000 campaigns launched on the site every month, and a revenue model that has grown by 500% in 2 years. We're growing quickly, and our users win campaigns for change once every hour. From strengthening hate crime legislation in South Africa; calling for Racial Justice in the US; fighting corruption in Indonesia, Italy, and Brazil; to fighting violence against women in India.

We are looking for Senior Analysts who are great at structured problem solving, building beautiful reports, writing SQL at scale, collaborating on solutions, and have a passion for expanding our platform to mobilize hundreds of millions of people to take deeper civic action.

You will report to our Director of Analytics and as a key member of our Strategy & Analytics team, you'll:

Work closely with other analysts to help campaigns and product teams make data-driven, strategic decisions. You'll be working to support our Organizer Success team, which provides campaigning advice and support to thousands of petition starters across the world.
Build high quality dashboards that are used across the organization to monitor key business performance and team specific results.
Participate in our weekly "office hours" to support colleagues from all around the world on their analytics questions.
Perform end-to-end, complex analysis from discovery, to execution and delivery, in a fast-paced yet supportive environment.
Join a team of individuals who are passionate about data and social change and have a hunger to learn from each other.

You're a perfect fit for this role if you have a passion for learning, a roll-up-your-sleeves attitude, and your superpowers include creative problem-solving and writing SQL at scale!

The most important capabilities for the role are:

TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE: You are excellent at writing performant and clean SQL (any kind of SQL, though we use Redshift SQL). You are also comfortable with spreadsheets (Excel, Google Sheets), including pivot tables, index match, and vlookups.

PROBLEM SOLVING: You have a structured approach to problem-solving. You show strong critical thinking skills and ask questions to understand the purpose and trajectory of your work. You suggest appropriate alternatives when necessary.

WORKING WITH and OWNING STAKEHOLDER RELATIONSHIPS: You have experience partnering with stakeholders to develop analysis plans and solutions. You ask necessary questions and gather context from stakeholders to guide your work.

ADAPTABILITY: Appetite for learning new skills, particularly statistical methods and analysis tools

COMMUNICATION: You have experience tailoring your communication style to your audience (C-team, executives, peers, etc.). You demonstrate strong written communication skills and can write clear and concise analysis write ups.


Target experience:

3+ years of experience in analytics, statistics, or data science, ideally in a consumer-facing Internet platform organization
2+ years of owning key stakeholder relationships and owning everything from requirements gathering to execution.
Proficiency with key Data Analytics tools: SQL to gather data, ETLs to create aggregate tables, Google Sheets / Excel to analyze and summarize findings.
Interest or experience in activism and social change work would be a big plus!


Interested? Great! Here's what you should know:

This is a Full-time 6 month fixed term role (with the potential to become permanent) and while we strongly prefer candidates based in either New York City or the SF Bay Area, we are open to anyone residing on the West or East Coast who are open to relocate or commute to the Brooklyn/SF office at least twice a week in the future. For now the team will be 100% remote through at least January 2022. Our team is high impact, low ego, and has an amazing culture to be part of!

Our compensation philosophy is rooted in pay equity and pay transparency. We determine salary based on the cost of labor within the state and/or each major city. A Senior Analyst in San Francisco is 115,000 and $110,000 in New York City.

We anticipate moving quickly on this role. Our evaluation process and tentative timeline is as follows:

Recruiter Screen (60 min)
Take Home Assessment (2 hours)
Virtual Onsite - Hiring Manager + Team member (60 min)
Executive Interview - VP of Finance Analytics and Strategy (45 min)
Offer


We especially encourage applicants of different backgrounds, cultures, genders, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We're actively working to increase the diversity of experience and perspectives on our team and are looking for someone who can help continue to lead that process.

Change.org is committed to being a diverse and inclusive workplace. Everyone says this, right? Well, we mean it - we invest in serious programs to bring in and support women and people of color, we have in-person onboarding experiences and affinity groups to help everyone feel included, we regularly celebrate the heritage of all staff, and we believe strongly in consistent, fair, and transparent salary scales to help level the playing field. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, or disability or veteran status.

We're working for a world where no one is powerless, and where creating change is a part of everyday life. We're just getting started and hope you'll join us.

We're committed to protecting your data. To learn more, please review our Change.org Job Applicant CCPA Privacy Notice here.

We Breathe Life Into Data!

At Komodo Health, our mission is to reduce the global burden of disease. Smarter use of data is essential to this mission. We combine the world's most comprehensive view of patient encounters with innovative algorithms and decades of clinical expertise to power our Healthcare Map, the industry's most precise view of the U.S. healthcare system. With the Healthcare Map as our foundation, we offer a suite of powerful software applications that deliver exceptional value to the industry.

Our people are the center of our success. We are a smart, supportive team with diverse perspectives and a shared passion for fixing what's broken in healthcare. It's fun, challenging and important. Join us!
The Opportunity at Komodo Health:

The objective of this role is to discover and extract insights from our Healthcare Map to answer the critical business questions facing our life science customers.

Looking back on your first 12 months at Komodo Health:

Over the course of 12 months, the Associate will have supported a number of projects across most of the Analytics Consulting group offerings. By this time, the Associate should have developed several skill sets and built a personal knowledge base across key areas:

Creating appropriate cohorts based on customer business needs, leveraging internal tools such as our PRISM encounters browser and data tools such as SQL
Understanding patient-level data and the visualization of patient journeys across various dimensions
Synthesizing results of models and data queries to develop a story to answer the key business questions for various projects

What you bring to Komodo:

You are a problem solver: Demonstrate strong logical thinking, quantitative reasoning proficiency, and ability to see patterns
You have a partnership mentality: Effectively partner with data science colleagues to guide analysis and interpret results
You are curious: Show an interest and aptitude for constant learning; seeks and welcomes assistance from colleagues
You have a flexible attitude: Can adapt to changing environment; possess a willingness to attack problems from new angle
You must have: Advanced Excel skills; experience translating analytic insights into PowerPoint; prior life sciences or healthcare experience; customer-facing experience and technical experience with tools such as SQL, Python, R, Snowflake

#LI- BW1

JobTitle: Data Engineer, Clinical Decision Support Solutions-REMOTE
Content_text:
Wondering what’s within Beckman Coulter?
Take a closer look.

Join a team where you can be heard, be supported, and always be yourself. At Beckman Coulter, a Danaher company, we’re building a culture that celebrates backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all our associates. At first glance, you will see we are dedicated to advancing and optimizing the laboratory to move science and health care forward for more than 80 years. Look again and see we're invested in you and give the opportunity to build a meaningful career, be creative, and try new things with the support you need to be successful.

Find the Danaher Business System , which makes everything possible. You will also see a company that investors trust—our culture of continuous improvement has helped us outperform the S&P 500 by more than 5,000% over the past 25 years.

And no matter where you look at Beckman Coulter, at the heart of what we do, you’ll witness our shared purpose—helping realize life’s potential—in action. Our work helps improve millions of lives.

We hope you’ll see yourself here, too.

What you find at Beckman Coulter —and within yourself — might just change the world!

The Data Engineer for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics is responsible for helping shape an innovative digital diagnostics portfolio of new offerings that use machine learning and AI technology to improve clinical outcomes, and you will collaborate with a team of highly skilled software engineers and data scientists to deliver these predictive analytics to healthcare providers via integrated CDS solutions. You will accomplish this by being hands-on and collaborating with your team, other business groups, electronic health record (EHR) vendors, clinicians, and hospital IT teams. Your projects will leverage data from medical diagnostics and electronic health records to deliver actionable insights.

This position is part of Beckman Coulter Diagnostics and is a REMOTE position or based in one of Beckman Coulter’s offices in Brea, CA, Miami, FL or Chaska, MN . We are seeking passionate and ambitious individuals who are ready to join us in this cutting-edge digital healthcare transformation journey!

You will be a part of the Clinical Decision Support Solutions team and report to the Sr Data Scientist responsible for the design, development and delivery of machine learning solutions for Beckman Coulter Diagnostics. If you thrive in a dynamic fast-paced environment and have a strong sense of urgency and proven ability to lead resources in a flexible and adaptable environment —read on.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:
Work with stakeholders to understand data requirements for ML projects and build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, AWS, and Azure ‘big data’ technologies.
Assemble large, complex data sets from disparate sources, writing code, scripts, and queries, as appropriate, to efficiently extract and harmonize data.
Identify, design, and implement continuous process improvements such as automating manual processes and optimizing data delivery.
Document data processes, write data management recommended procedures, and create training materials relating to data management best practices.

The essential requirements of the job include:
Advanced degree (Bachelor’s required, Master’s preferred) in engineering, science, mathematics, or related field with healthcare experience. Familiarity with healthcare data standards, data ontologies, toolchains, and operating procedures.
Experience in developing and managing enterprise-scale data warehouse, data marts, and multidimensional data models with a successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
Willingness to travel up to 25% is required (post-pandemic)

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:
Experience working with cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Knowledge of the latest machine learning and data visualization methods as applied in business contexts. Knowledge of shared data science development and analytics environments such as JupyterLab.

Beckman Coulter, a Danaher company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to associates’ and their families’ lives. Whether it’s a health care program, paid time off, or 401K savings plans our programs give to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com . We believe you’ll like what you see.

When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.

Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies require all US and Puerto Rico employees to be vaccinated against COVID–19 as a condition of employment, subject to reasonable accommodation as required by law.

WHAT WE DO MATTERS:

Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In 16 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, Hitched, The Bash, The Bump, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life's milestones. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.

ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:

The Knot Worldwide is in search of a full-time Data Scientist. Our Data Scientists work with stakeholders across all departments within the company. They answer strategic questions and provide insight to internal decision makers ranging from executives and senior management to product managers and team leads. They also work with our product team to develop data driven algorithms that improve features on the website.

This opening is for our Marketplace zone which connects over 2 million engaged couples with +50,000 local wedding vendors (e.g. Venue, DJ, Florist, etc.) across the US each year. This position plays an essential role in solving complex problems across our two-sided marketplace in areas such as pricing, product strategy, and go-to-market optimization.

We are open to this role being based out of our New York City, NY or Washington, DC office locations.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Create smarter product solutions for our couples and vendors
Answer strategic questions by analyzing behavioral data
Communicate, collaborate and present results to clients within The Knot Worldwide
Explore novel ways to look at our data

SUCCESSFUL DATA SCIENTIST CANDIDATES HAVE:

Master's Degree or Ph.D. preferred
Experience implementing auction based business models
Strong product experience
Proficiency in key statistical and machine learning techniques (predictive modeling, classification, clustering, text analytics, recommender systems , data mining methods, forecasting, and other advanced techniques)
Proficiency with R or Python
Familiarity with common Linux command line tasks and version control software like git or svn preferable
Ability to communicate effectively and influence others
Ability to work in a fast paced environment and shift gears quickly

At The Knot Worldwide, we believe you are more than a resume and invite you to go for it, take the leap of faith, and apply for this job if it sparks your passion to join TKWW and make a difference!

WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:

You Dream Big. You iterate and experiment to drive innovation.
You Love Our Users. You keep our global community at the center of everything you do.
You Do the Right Thing. You strengthen your team through respect, fairness, and inclusion.
You Hustle Every Day. You favor urgency and own your outcomes.
You Win Together. People are at the heart of our success and you play as a team.

WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:

The Knot Worldwide offers a unique employee experience and we are deeply proud of our award-winning culture. We offer a full benefits package including options for medical, dental and vision insurance and a 401k with company match. From flexible vacation and generous parental leave benefits to promoting wellness and giving back to our community, we believe in happiness above all else—in and out of the office.

Company Description
Dentsu International is a modern marketing solutions company. Our mission is to help clients navigate, progress, and thrive in a world of change. Businesses rely on our integrated network of agencies and specialized practices to champion meaningful progress through creative, media, commerce, data, and technology. Part of Dentsu Group, our global network comprises 66,000 diverse people in 143 countries, who are dedicated to teaming for growth and good. Some of our award-winning agencies include 360i, Carat, dentsumcgarrybowen, DEG, dentsuX, iProspect and Merkle. Follow us on Twitter @DentsuUSA and visit dentsu.com/us.

Job Description
The primary focus of dentsu’s Data Science team is to devise robust yet simple, actionable solutions to drive our clients’ business goals. Our clients see us as trusted advisors and depend on our subject matter expertise to enhance decision making via our deep (and constantly evolving) marketing analytics capabilities. For this role, we are looking for someone who is deeply experienced in the application of advanced statistic and econometric methodologies in both theory and practice for both traditional and digital media. Candidates should be intellectually curious and pragmatic self-starters who possess demonstrable experience leading projects through to completion.
Responsibilities
Manage client data science and advanced analytics engagements with a focus on delivery:
Manage client communications and final deliverables
Work in close collaboration with Analytics, Client Service and channel delivery teams to set agendas and develop media optimization opportunities
Build internal and external timelines and project plans using Agile Project Management
Lead the gathering of user stories, brainstorming sessions, development, and eventual deployment of generalized and custom analytical tools outside of client specific work
Actively lead specific team-wide learning and development initiatives, including:
Research into and the advancement of statistical or econometric methodologies
R&D for new app or tool development ideas, including the development of MVP and proof-of-concept media science applications
Development of both bespoke and productized media science solutions
Interface directly with clients and internal leadership to deliver results of a specific analysis and guide interpretation of analytics outputs and how to implement results

Qualifications

Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD in a relevant quantitative field
3-5 years of hands-on working experience in Data Science capacity with a minimum of two years working in digital media (agency or client-side)
Strong foundation in either Python or R, with working knowledge of the following libraries/modules:
Python: pandas, NumPy, StatsModels, SciKit-learn, Matplotlib
R: tidyverse (dplyr, tidyr, purrr, ggplot2), lme4, shiny
Functional working proficiency with Git (GitHub & BitBucket)
Familiarity with relational databases and the cloud (e.g., AWS/GCP/Azure)
Exposure to and understanding of several key econometric and statistical frameworks:
Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, ARIMA, Kalman Filter, BSTS, Decision Trees, RandomForest, Factor Analysis, KNN, K-Means, etc.
Possess the ability to mentor a team, take ownership, and operate independently to solve to client requests using a combination of critical thinking and initiative
The demonstrated ability to translate complex processes into client-friendly terms
Experience with marketing response models and their applications a plus
Strong communication and presentation skills, including the ability to take complex subject matter and concisely communicate it to a wide range of audiences – from senior executives to deep subject matter experts
Additional Information
Employees from diverse or underrepresented backgrounds encouraged to apply.

Job Description
This newly created role will lead the EHS+S Business Insights and Analytics team of individuals responsible for building and deploying tools for the Global EHS+S department to support daily operations and drive program improvements enabling us to meet our FY goals and objectives. This role will create and establish enabling system related to Business Insights and Analytics to support the EHS+S organization worldwide (scope: 100 EHS+S professionals worldwide) that includes numerous regulatory reports, ESG goals, external sustainability reporting, and Company required reporting. This position will collaborate with the GSC COE and their BI team to deliver best in class service to our partners and ensure accurate reporting of all data within the system’s ecosystem and verify data accuracy as required by the Company’s strategy.
Job Responsibilities
Responsible for the set up and management of the EHS+S Business Insights and Analytics team
Lead team of EHS+S Reporting and Data Visualization experts
Serve as the main Business Insights & Analytics point of contact for the EHS+S and partner with Supply Chain Business Insights & Analytics Leads across the Company
EHS+S Reporting
Develops systems to report all EHS compliance, leading indicator and sustainability metrics across the Company.
Oversees workstream that performs regulatory required classification and IT systems/tables including SAP necessary to enable the proper classification of ELC raw materials, mass, and finished goods
Support the corporate EHS auditing program with management of the reporting system
Integrate legacy EHS+S systems with new global ELC systems
Data Visualization
Build a variety of views and dashboards to analyze and predict EHS+S scenarios
Leverage data visualization tools to run scenarios and determine optimum business decisions, risks and opportunities in partnership with the EHS+S Team
Manage and interpret the global collection of all data for all compliance and sustainability activities from the company.
Manage data collection, views and dashboards for safety programs including but not limited to BBS, leading and lagging indicators
Assist auditing, LMS & ISO program with management of the collection tool and regular reporting cadence of compliance status
Oversee workstream and team responsible for hazard communication and transportation classifications.
Leads the reporting of data to enable the interpretation of results and updating of EHS+S KPIs
SUSTAINABILITY AND EHS REPORTING
Ensures reporting of all ESG information to GCCS and other B/R/F to ensure corporate reporting is executed on-time. Work with internal partners across all B/R/F to collect the information. Work with external partners for external verification of data to meet ELC’s ESG goals. Ensure accurate reporting for all EHS compliance reporting to various regulatory authorities (local, state, regional, federal.
Ensure verification of data sets is completed per requirements needed by the GCCS team and external reporting needs.
DIGITATION
Transition EHS+S data from current systems to new global reporting systems. allowing local and global EHS&S teams to focus on higher value activities (accident reduction, energy conservation, compliance activities, etc.)
Automate reports, analytics, data management, reporting (predictive and historic) and training systems (LMS) either leveraging external technology 3rd parties (ESG Software) or existing internal platform (ex. Cr360).
Define and lead EHS+S Business Insights and Analytics strategy by determining business needs, issues and scenarios from EHS+S SVP, Pillar Leads, and Functional and Brand Leadership
Educate the EHS+S on service offerings, and build Business Insights & Analytics capability across the function
Partner closely with IT to identify, acquire and maintain data sets data, allowing data to be pulled together in a new way across the entire corporation
Build collaborative partnerships and insights culture within EHS+S including, but not limited to EHS+S Pillar Leads, GCCS, BI Platform leads within ELC, Supply Chain COE Leadership

Qualifications
Qualifications/Requirements
Master’s Degree preferred in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field
Minimum 10 years of related experience in an Operations Consulting or Data Science role related to statistical forecasting and advanced data analytics
“Working Leader;” must be able to lead work while delivering business insights and analytics across various stakeholders
Proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights
Entrepreneurial spirit and inquisitive
Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills and a proven ability to build collaborative partnerships
Effective influencing and listening skills, as well as flexibility, a strong work ethic and strategic thinking are valued assets
Service orientation and results focused
Can handle a heavy workload with competing priorities
Knowledge of, and hands-on experience with statistical modeling packages preferred
Familiar with environmental, health, safety & sustainability data

Work you'll do


The Strategic Analytics Finance team provides analytical and finance services in support of the Deloitte Consulting Executive Committee. Within Operations & Finance, the Analytics team specializes in providing a forward-looking perspective and helping leadership to make key business decisions. This role will be responsible for leading and supporting a range of deep analytical and predictive modeling projects that drive strategic objectives and improve business performance.


Good communication, strategic thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills are required to be successful in this role. This role creates great value for the business by providing high quality, actionable recommendations in support of business decision making and performance improvement.


Job Responsibilities

Designs and implements predictive and statistical models to forecast future business performance leveraging advanced machine learning platforms.
Analyzes internal and external data to understand performance drivers and identify improvement opportunities
Streamlines and automates analytical processes and data pipelines that feed predictive models and dashboards for leadership
Examines Deloitte Consulting's businesses from different perspectives, finding new analytical insights, while establishing analytics as a sustainable, world-class capability
Works across Deloitte Consulting's businesses to support the Enabling Areas and Business Functions in a variety of special and complex analytics projects
Communicate analysis and recommendations in a clear, succinct manner and produce leadership-quality deliverables that explain, present and analyze the financial performance and plans of the business


The team


The Consulting Operations & Finance team provides specialized analytical and finance services in support of the Deloitte Consulting Leadership. The team drives key processes including strategic analytics, long-range financial planning, external and internal trend analysis, annual planning and investments analysis.

Qualifications


Required:

Minimum of 5+ years of relevant experience with focus on advanced analytics and predictive modeling
Deep knowledge about machine learning algorithms such as random forests, clustering, logistic regression, etc.
Advanced experience in Dataiku and/or DataRobot.
Bachelor's degree in Cognitive Science, Statistics or related field


Preferred:
Experience in data visualization and statistical modeling tools (e.g., Tableau, Python, R)
Experience in UiPath

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. New York University: NYU - NY: Tandon School of Engineering
Location
Brooklyn, NY
Open Date
Mar 24, 2021
Description
The Cybersecurity for Democracy Project at NYU Tandon School of Engineering is seeking to
hire a Research Analyst to join an exciting NSF-funded project to better understand and mitigate
misinformation in digital political content. New York University (NYU) is one of the top private
universities in the United States, and the Tandon School of Engineering, located in Brooklyn, has
the distinct history of having been known previously as Brooklyn Poly and the NYU Polytechnic
School of Engineering.

The research analyst will work with our misinformation research partners to understand how
content experts use our tools to screen online content for misinformation and guide the
engineering team to build tools to meet those users' needs. The research analyst will help the
research team to develop a Spanish language analysis pipeline. They will do this by monitoring
US Spanish language political and cultural public discourse and working with the data science
team to develop Spanish language topic models. They will help coordinate research between the
engineering team and our research partners at other institutions.
Tandon faculty and students are at the forefront of the high-tech start-up culture in New York City
and have access to NYU’s Global Network University. The NYU Tandon School of Engineering is
deeply committed to excellence in teaching and learning. Tandon fosters student and faculty
innovation and entrepreneurship that make a difference in the world.

Qualifications
Candidates must be fluent in Spanish and be familiar with the different Spanish speaking communities in the United States.

Candidates must have very strong communication and organizational skills.
Candidates must have a Bachelor’s Degree or higher in a liberal arts, social science, or cultural studies field, or similar relevant professional experience.
Optionally, candidate experience with non-profit or civil society organizations is preferred, but not required.
Application Instructions
Applicants should submit a cover letter, a current CV and a list of three references with complete
contact information. All application materials should be submitted electronically via Interfolio. Review of applications will begin as soon as possible and will continue until the position is filled.

JobTitle: Counsel- Legal Data Management & Advisory Group
Content_text:
For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments, and it safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers.
As part of the safest and most trusted financial institutions, the BNY Mellon Legal Department mitigates risk and handles legal affairs to ensure the security of the company and its clients. BNY Mellon's Legal Department works with the various businesses on a wide range of client matters, has overall responsibility for government affairs, advises on advocacy and policy initiatives to support the company’s domestic and international operations, and supports all bank regulatory and supervisory matters.
Description
Financial Services Attorney with experience using and implementing legal technology to solve complex problems.
Description
BNY Mellon is seeking an experienced attorney to support the firm’s Legal Data Management & Advisory group, while secondarily carrying out various bespoke projects within the Legal Department. The successful candidate will be based in New York and will have the following responsibilities, among others:

Maintain and enhance the firm’s artificial intelligent legal agreement repository by advising on legal issues, building artificial intelligence/machine learning rules and providing guidance and quality checks to the firm’s on and off shore document review specialists.
Coordinate various departments and stakeholders, including but not limited to legal, operations, compliance and lines of business to execute activities.

Create work product and provide advice related to the interpretation of a variety of agreement types, including but not limited to, custody agreements, corporate trust agreements, master netting agreements, loan and credit related documented and collateral agreements.
Complete one off projects/tasks supporting the larger department in a timely manner.
Qualifications
JD, Member of the New York State Bar in good standing
Minimum 5 years of legal experience in the financial services industry
Candidate must have strong analytical skills; be a fast learner; have excellent oral, written and presentation communication skills; be a collaborative and collegial team player; demonstrate an ability to present in a variety of meetings and to senior management; be a self-starter and creative thinker who is able to work independently and take a proactive approach to the job; have strong planning and organizational skills; be able to deliver precise and timely work product; handle multi-tasking; and demonstrate initiative and high work standards at all times.
Candidate should be effective at using all available resources to resolve complex problems/issues. Candidate should be eager to learn and should not shy away from asking questions or difficult tasks.
Ideally, the candidate will have experience in the legal department of a large financial services organization and have familiarity with various types of financial services contracts. Experience working on large enterprise and/or regulatory change projects is also preferred.

BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.
Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

We are seeking a Data Scientist - Electrophysiology to help us develop our neural interfaces and analyze the data they generate. In this role you will help drive the state-of-the art in brain-computer interfaces (BCIs).
This is an extraordinary opportunity to join our core team to help to shape the future of our company. Your work will see commercialization quickly so that we improve the lives of patients who live with neurological disorders in a matter of months and years, not decades.
This position can be based in NYC or SF.
You will:
Complete analysis of experimental data obtained from micro-electrocorticographic electrodes recorded in vivo.
Collaborate with our software and neural interface teams to leverage large amounts of static and streaming data to create world-class computational tools for clinical use, including neural decoding.
Contribute to design, performance and coordination of electrophysiological experiments.
Collaborate with the rest of our team to publish and present our work.
Requirements
Master’s degree or above in electrical engineering or physics (or related field) with strong experience in real-time digital signal processing.
Has previously worked in a neuroscience laboratory on electrophysiology and ideally has published on this work.
Experience in analysis of large datasets using machine learning techniques, and experience in GPU-optimized computing (especially for digital signal processing).
Demonstrated history of self-directed scientific work with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Track record of delivering on accelerated timelines and budgets.
Precision Neuroscience is proud to be a member of NVIDIA’s AI Startups Accelerator program, giving us access to go-to-market support, expertise and technology.
Diverse workforces create the best culture, company, and products. We at Precision Neuroscience are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates the uniqueness and contributions of everyone. As an equal opportunity employer, Precision Neuroscience does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, religion, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

About Foursquare:

Foursquare is the leading independent location technology company, powered by our deep understanding of how people move throughout the world. Our solutions help businesses make smarter decisions, developers create more engaging experiences, and brands build more effective marketing strategies.

Foursquare's platform includes Attribution, Audience, Pinpoint, Proximity, Places, Pilgrim SDK and Visits. As the industry's first and only accredited company for location data from the Media Rating Council (MRC), this foundation powers all our solutions — those that exist today and those we have yet to build. Over 14 billion consumer-verified place visit confirmations help us keep our map and models fresh and up-to-date, building a phone's-eye-view of the world with 105 million unique places of interest worldwide.

About our Senior Data Scientist Role:

As a member of Foursquare's data science team, you'll be responsible for owning important methodological components of our leading foot traffic measurement platform. The methodologies we employ are varied which creates a rich environment for the application of data science technology. This is not just a machine learning job. We look for data scientists who are excited by the challenge of solving problems using a wide array of modeling and quantitative techniques.

To be successful, you'll have to have a deep technical understanding of data science concepts across the disciplines of research methods, causal modeling, applied statistics and machine learning. You'll also have the ability to build large-scale prototypes of your novel methodologies from the ground up.

The ideal Senior Data Scientist will also want to grow the impact that they have across the organization by taking on increasing responsibilities.

Responsibilities of the role:

Build supervised and unsupervised learning systems to extract visitation behavior from sensor data.
Drive feature engineering and experimentation to improve performance of our various algorithms
Collaborate with engineering teams on implementing and deploying large scale data processing pipelines
Build internal tools for monitoring and investigation purposes
Lead cross-team cooperation and mentor junior scientists

Qualifications

5+ years of work or educational experience in data science, machine learning, and statistics.
PhD degree or comparable research experience in a quantitative field
Proven track record of delivering on products and/or practical research endeavors
Experience with the Python science stack and/or Scala required
Experience with Hadoop, Spark, or similar frameworks is a plus

Foursquare is proud to foster an inclusive environment that is free from discrimination. We strongly believe in order to build the best products, we need a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds. This leads to a more delightful experience for our users and team members. We value listening to every voice and we encourage everyone to come be a part of building a company and products we love.

Foursquare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We're Melio, a NY-based startup on a mission to keep small businesses in business. Our online payment solution enables small businesses in the US to pay their bills in more efficient ways that improve their finances and free them up to focus more on managing the business they love.

Backed by top-tier VCs, we have a unique approach to small business payments and aim to make B2B payments as simple and easy as peer-to-peer payment apps. We're growing fast and looking for enthusiastic team players.

We are looking for an experienced, passionate, and driven Senior Data Analyst to take part in our data related efforts in the Sales and CS teams. As a Senior Data Analyst, you'll be working across all NY teams, as a part of the Data Analysis team. This is a unique opportunity to join one of our most strategic and growing business units.


How you'll make an impact

Report to the Data Analytics Manager in TLV and be a part of a small team of Data Analysts
Oversee the entire data, analytics, and BI domain across the business unit - from building yearly and quarterly work plans to managing and prioritizing day-to-day activities
Partner with Sales, CS, CX and operation teams to provide high-impact insights and evangelize data-driven decision making
Work directly with the Unit's management to provide data insights and BI solutions
Carry out a hands-on meta-analysis for various company needs
Support our high-scale conversion optimization and testing efforts through statistical models and data-driven analysis
Collaborate with the TLV Data Analytics team, to keep one source of truth and keep the same methodology
Develop insights-based presentations from analytics and present internally & support external stakeholders
Create forecasts and actionable recommendations for business decisions


What we'd love to see
4+ years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experience in fast growing high-tech companies
Significant experience working with SQL. Knowledge of Python - advantage
Experience in working with BI tools
Knowledge/experience in optimization and testing space - (A/B) split tests, multivariate tests.
Exceptional communication skills, ability to work with senior management and lead strategic cross-company projects and liaising with other international offices
University degree, B.Sc. preferred, in Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field


Benefits And Perks

100% health insurance coverage on selected plans (medical/dental/vision)
Competitive compensation plans
401K matching
Equity
Flexible PTO
Weekly lunch perks
Zoom yoga
Plenty of fun team activities
Extensive career growth and development opportunities throughout a growing startup
