Explorium is a cutting-edge data science company that has recently closed a Series C round bringing their total funding to $120 million.
Explorium offers a first of its kind data science platform powered by augmented data discovery and feature engineering. By automatically connecting to thousands of external data sources and leveraging machine learning to distill the most impactful signals, the Explorium platform empowers data scientists and business leaders to drive decision-making by eliminating the barrier to acquire the right data and enabling superior predictive power.
About the Role:
We are looking for an experienced, passionate data scientist to join our Client Facing Data Science team . In this consultative role, you’ll be relied on to interface directly with our clients and prospects, and guide them through data science initiatives from end to end. You’ll develop predictive models, discover hidden connections between client and external data sources, and communicate the insights to our clients. You’ll be exposed to a wide variety of clients across multiple industries (fintech, marketing, real estate, and more), and will be solving tough, real-world business problems using a the latest ML models, feature selection algorithms, and MLOps technologies. Key Responsibilities:
Present and demonstrate Explorium’s product to prospective clients - both technical and non-technical executives.
Design use case objectives and success criteria, with an understanding of our capabilities and client needs.
Develop data enrichment solutions and predictive models to address the business objectives of our clients, both during the proof-of-concept phase and as part of ongoing engagements.
Find and create bespoke data sources, leveraging web-scraping, API automation, and other creative approaches, and integrate them into Explorium’s codebase.
Requirements:

Basic Qualifications
Proficiency in Python, Data Analysis tools such as Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Plotly, SQL
Experience in Data Science/Engineering roles or projects exemplifying expertise
Eager to get hands-on experience in a variety of use-cases and industries
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with BI tools, cloud solutions (AWS/GCP)
Experience with production grade software development
Consulting / customer-facing experience
CompSci degree or other software-oriented backgrounds
Some of our benefits:
Medical, dental, vision
401k Retirement Plan
Unlimited Paid Time Off
Employee referral bonus program
**We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas.

Odeko is the enablement arm powering small coffee shops and cafes with everything from supply chain management and mobile ordering to tech solutions that make your favorite local shop more efficient. It's our goal to help these small businesses increase their revenue, lower their expenses, and reduce their environmental footprint. We are passionate about our customers, and we rely on an ambitious team that operates within a collaborative environment to deliver on our mission.
The Data Science Team

Our Data Science Team is dedicated to aggressively applying the scientific method to high velocity technical innovation across the entire spectrum of the company, from business and markets, to predictive systems and hardware for clients and customers. This is not a place to throw spaghetti at walls and "see what sticks", but a place where a deep understanding of statistics, probability, and experiment design allow us to identify, develop, and deploy research and technology at break-neck speeds. We are experts in understanding failure and spend every minute of every day cultivating deeper and stronger abilities to bring ourselves to the edge of it just before catastrophe strikes. Of course we do miss - and so will you, but together we will learn from each crash and use it to push the limits even further.

If you are willing to admit daily that you have more to learn, we are looking for you. If you are dedicated to jumping just as fast to pick up the dirty work as you are the beautiful work, we are looking for you. If you are willing to become dedicated to the scientific process, and not the project, we are looking for you. Join us.

What you'll do:

Build, optimize and scale new technologies and services developed within the the Data Science ecosystem
Transition new technologies and services from research into the production environment using proper methods and procedures
Help build and connect back-end and front-end processes/software to new and existing technologies and services
Serve as a technical resource and engineering mentor for other developers
Our Engineering tech stack comprises Ruby/Rails, Haskell/Servant, Vue.js (Typescript/JavaScript), iOS (Swift), Android (Kotlin), ReactNative (Typescript) on top of Kubernetes, Docker and AWS. We employ modern DevOps and SRE practices such as CI/CD, rolling deployments, observability, and error budgets.

Our Data Science tech stack includes but is not limited to: R, R shiny, Python, AWS, SQL, and multitudes of various data resources (APIs, Scrapers, etc)

Experience:

You have experience building and supporting mission-critical production applications. The number of years is less important than the fact that you've lived the full product lifecycle multiple times, from idea to maturity, and have learned what works and what doesn't.
You have experience in full-stack development, ideally on top of Ruby on Rails, but we're flexible.
You understand the value of well-designed, well-documented, discoverable APIs and you are willing to build, maintain, and evolve them.
You're a committed team player and love to collaborate on solutions with others, both inside and outside of Data Science
You take an analytical but pragmatic approach to problem solving.
You're excited to architect systems for improving scalability and maintainability across our codebase.
You have a track record of delivering high-quality software on time.
You are curious and interested. If you don't know something, you find the answer.

Why you'll love working at Odeko:

The Data Science team has 2 major focus areas; knocking out high quality innovation, and making sure the team members that do that are given every possible resource to grow and enjoy their time at Odeko! How is that for math, 50% of our focus is on YOU! We don't care if you want to learn how to build cutting edge A.I. or just learn how to weave reed baskets, the entire team is there to support you and help lift you as high as we can.

We are open to remote candidates, but only within the United States and Belfast, NI.
Odeko is committed to building an inclusive, diverse team. We offer competitive benefits and the opportunity to truly grow. If this sounds good to you, we'd love to hear from you!

No third-parties please.

JobTitle: Data Engineer, Analytics Tagging & Data Collection
Content_text:
WW is looking for candidates to help change people’s lives. We are a global wellness technology company inspiring millions of people to adopt healthy habits for real life. We do this through engaging digital experiences, face-to-face workshops and sustainable programs that encourage people to move more, shift their mindset and eat healthier while enjoying the foods they love. By drawing on over five decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities in order to deliver wellness for all.
WW is looking for candidates to help change people’s lives. We are a global wellness technology company inspiring millions of people globally to adopt sustainable healthy habits for real life. We do this through apps, face-to-face workshops, and sustainable programs that encourage people to move more, and shift their mindset and eat healthier while enjoying the foods they love. By drawing on over five decades of experience and expertise in behavioral science, we build communities to deliver wellness for all.
Role Overview
We’re looking for a data engineer for the web tagging team. The tagging team owns the Google Analytics implementation for WW web pages. Future work will include tagging and management for WW’s system that records user actions in WW’s apps.
The tagging team administers the website in Google Analytics, GTM, and other tools; and codes automation to make the team’s work faster and more reliable.
This is right for you if you are aimed at making a difference, and want to drive understanding of how a business works and how a company can succeed.
With over 13M monthly web visitors users and over 5M members around the world using our apps to log everything they eat and drink; when they sleep; how they feel; what workouts they do; and more; this is an opportunity to work on a large problem at an established brand that does good in the world. This is an opportunity to make sure WW can see what users are doing so that WW can bring healthy lifestyles to more members and to make the WW apps even more successful in helping those members develop healthy habits.
Key Responsibilities
Google Analytics administration
Design, build, and maintain tagging, UTM codes, and other aspects of Google Analytics on the WW website
Revise tagging and systems to comply with consent management regulations and requirements
Collaborate with Digital Marketing, Data Analytics, Product Development, and Business Intelligence partners to make sure they can get the user-behavior data they need
Collaborate with Engineering on the WW user-behavior data-collection system for WW Apps
Create and maintain documentation on how things are set up in GA and in App data collection
Requirements
Required
5+ years experience with tagging, setting up, and maintaining Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics to support digital marketing
Hands-on experience with:
Google Tag Manager
Google Analytics administration
Planning and setting up custom variables/dimensions
JavaScript
SQL
Debugging tools like Google Tag Assistant
Able to participate effectively in open collaborative discussions with the team
Preferred
Bachelor's degree; masters or advanced degree preferred
Other education/certifications in a related field
Hands-on experience with:
Python or similar scripting language
Automating tasks like tag quality assurance
Google Analytics API
Collaborating with app developers to set up user-action logging in apps
Analyzing Google Analytics data exported to BigQuery
Updating systems to comply with GDPR privacy regulations
Facebook pixel, Facebook server-to-server, and other online experience tracking tools
Data Analytics, or Data Science
A/B testing; multivariate testing
Optimizely; Braze
Database design and development
Agile work environments (stand-ups, kanban boards, sprints, etc.)
At WW, it is our priority to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are committed as individuals, as an organization, and as fellow humans, to advocate for and support our employees, our members, and our communities. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, creed, national origin, marital status, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

Founded in 2015, Bowery Farming is on a mission to democratize access to high-quality, local, safe and sustainable produce. Bowery builds smart indoor farms near cities, growing fresher, pesticide-free Protected Produce with bold flavor in precisely controlled environments, 365 days a year. At the heart of each farm is the proprietary BoweryOS, which integrates software, hardware, sensors, AI, computer vision systems, machine learning models and robotics to orchestrate and automate the entirety of its operations. As a result, each farm creates far less waste and uses a fraction of the water and land compared to traditional agriculture.

About The Role:
Data Science at Bowery means building production-facing data products which automate the agricultural and operational functions in our network of indoor vertical farms. The Data & AI function at Bowery is central to the vision of the company as well as its day to day operation. You’ll work with our team of data scientists and analysts as well as agricultural scientists and supply chain managers who bring domain expertise to our data-driven solutions.
What You'll Do:
You’ll create innovative quantitative solutions and advance the state of indoor farming alongside mechanical engineers, agricultural scientists, and the farm operations team.
You'll combine agricultural considerations with production demands to maximize plant growth and fulfillment probability.
You’ll optimize work and production schedules to achieve the highest utilization of grow time and space in the farm.
You’ll use the key drivers of Bowery's business and agricultural science to design experimental frameworks to ensure data integrity and empower us to more easily analyze and act upon data from new trials.
You'll analyze historical data related to crop growth and environmental characteristics to forecast yields for future harvests and uncover insights about ways conditions can be optimized.
You'll help shape the way our data science team does work - researching and making key decisions about what we build, how we build it, and which tools are best for solving our problems.
You'll work alongside software engineers to implement data processing and visualization systems that make data readily available and simplify how insights are communicated.
You won’t target ads, optimize signup funnels, or recommend anything for anyone to click on.
Who You Are:
You have a strong mathematical background in probability, statistics, and optimization algorithms.
You are fluent in Python and enjoy building software the team can depend on.
You are proficient with SQL and can work “full stack” to integrate solutions with our data ecosystem.
You have a deep understanding of and have applied various machine learning techniques for solving real-world problems.
You are energized by translating business, operations, and agricultural questions into data science problems, solving those problems, and interpreting the output back into clear outcomes.
You are confident in taking ownership of projects from start to finish and enjoy the process of turning nebulous ideas into reality.
Who We Are:
Bowery is a place where everyone is welcome, included and empowered to reach their full potential.
We live our shared values every day in both big and small ways: opt-in, think wildly different, break barriers together & be kind to the core We are a mission-driven team of unconventional thinkers, problem-solvers, optimists and activators.
We share a passion for giving back more to the planet than we take, growing deliciously abundant food without abundant harm.
We are excited to hear from you!
Based in New York City, Bowery is the largest vertical farming company in the United States, serving major e-commerce platforms and more than 850 grocery stores in the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic regions, including Albertsons Companies (Safeway and Acme), Amazon Fresh, Giant Food, Walmart, Weis, Whole Foods Market, and specialty grocers, with produce that's harvested year-round at peak freshness, delivered within days of harvest. Bowery has raised $472 million from leading investors, including Fidelity Management & Research Company LLC, Temasek, GV (formerly Google Ventures), General Catalyst, GGV Capital, First Round Capital, and individuals including Henry Kravis, Jeff Wilke, as well as some of the foremost thought leaders in food, including Tom Colicchio, José Andrés and David Barber of Blue Hill. For more information on Bowery and its products, please visit www.BoweryFarming.comPress kit: https://boweryfarming.com/press/
We celebrate unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures that enrich the workplace. Join us in creating an inclusive work environment that is free of bias and discrimination, where everyone can be their authentic self. We strongly encourage people from all walks of life and underrepresented backgrounds to apply and join the Bowery Farming team. We are an equal opportunity employer.

As a Data Engineer at Hinge, you will create essential data processes and contribute to components of a modern data pipeline that will be the foundation of Hinge’s decision-making ability. The systems you help create, the problems you help solve, and the support of our analytical minds, will be pivotal to the success of Hinge.
This role is key to Hinge’s success. Not only will you help power the love lives of tons of people, but will play a critical part in the functioning of every team at Hinge, with stakeholders ranging from customer experience to marketing to leadership.
The Data Engineer will be implementing critical ETL pipelines, building fascinating data sets, and improving core functionality that will not only aid the data engineering team, but the rest of the organization. They will be working on an actual big data architecture while concentrating on real-world problems such as building core business reporting.
Responsibilities
Work with our Engineering teams to ensure data is flowing accurately through data creation to our presentation layers.
Write new and innovative ETL processes.
Improve our Data Engineering stack through containerization, data modeling, developing our ETL pipelines, and more.
Use your expertise in data modeling to design, build and maintain our analytics data warehouse that provides clean, accurate, and robust data sets to be leveraged for reporting and analytics.
Work with stakeholders and our Business Intelligence and Data Science subject matter experts in order to translate their needs and expectations into action items and deliverables.
Continue to learn more about the Data Engineering discipline, utilize that knowledge in your deliverables, and identify opportunities to enhance our pipelines.
Contribute meaningful insights and feedback to our team processes.
Requirements
Proficient in Python, SQL, shell scripting, and databases.
3+ years of professional/industry experience.
Experience delivering data products from conception to delivery and with the infrastructure that supports their underlying processes.
Good communication skills (written/verbal).
Experience modeling data sets for different types of sources and business processes.
Passionate about designing elegant ETL processes.
Familiarity with our stack (Kubernetes, Docker, Kafka, Redshift, Airflow, Hive, Looker) and with different modeling techniques such as data vault.
Our Company:
Hinge is the dating app for people who want to get off dating apps. In today’s digital world, singles are so busy matching that they’re not actually connecting, in person, where it counts. Hinge is on a mission to change that. So we built an app that’s designed to be deleted. On Hinge, there are no rules, timers, or games. Instead, you’ll meet your most compatible matches and you’ll have unique conversations over what you’ve shared on your detailed profile. It’s a natural way to find a great first date. Currently, 3 out of 4 first dates lead to second dates, we’re the #1 mobile-first dating app mentioned in the New York Times wedding section, and we’re the fastest growing dating app in the US, UK, Canada, and Australia.
Our Culture:Authenticity: Share your genuine thoughts and opinions directly.Courage: Invite and deeply consider challenges and criticism.Empathy: Be empathetic, communitarian and trustworthy.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

JobTitle: L'Oreal USA, Manager Advanced Analytics & Data Analyst
Content_text:
L'OREAL USA
10 Hudson Yards, New York NY
L'Oreal USA has returned to the office under our Safe Together guidelines. All eligible employees will be in the office three days a week and able to work remote two days a week. This does not apply to warehouse, distribution center, lab, field or retail store employees. We are excited to return to our collaborative, innovative environment in a safe and meaningful way! This does mean that we cannot accept fully remote candidates for this role at this time.
Title: Manager, Advanced Analytics – Data Analyst
Location: New York, NY
Department: Advanced Analytics
The Department: The Advanced Analytics team is responsible for driving best in class measurement solutions and tool development across LUSA, partnering with the business to consult and address the rapidly changing marketing landscape. It aims to evolve tool and analytical capability based on business priorities and requirements while providing consumer and market information that facilitates management decision-making on broad strategic as well as tactical day-to-day marketing and business issues.
Job Summary: L’Oréal is looking for an analytical thinker knowledgeable in the online/offline digital ecosystem. The primary goal of this position is to be able to integrate multiple sources of data and identify the right predictive models to deliver key business insights to the L’Oreal USA organization.
Key Job Accountabilities:
Extract, clean and model data from multiple data sources to get the right insight and put together a presentation for management as needed
Integrate and Load Data to a centralized location (if needed) and perform exploratory Data Analysis on the data loaded.
Choose the right Predictive or Machine Learning model for the problem
Help setup and conduct in-house A/B testing models for testing and validating various media tactics.
Develop expertise and run/build media simulations based on saturation curves/results from Mix models.
Help setup and run marketing modeling mix models using either in-house models or licensed 3rd party tools
Preferred Key Experiences:
Bachelor’s degree is required; Advanced degree in Statistics (MA) a strong plus.
2-3 years of experience in Advanced Analytics and Modelling at a CPG company/Retail/Pharma
Possess a passion for data science and data analysis, creating specific systems and tracking how they perform over time, data mining and so on.
Ability to quickly and easily transform data into key insights and actionable recommendations
Any background in experimental design, A/B testing will be very beneficial
L'Oreal Competencies:
Acts/Leads with Human Sensitivity - Demonstrates respect, develops others, enriches team dynamics
Interacts Effectively - Listens and communicates effectively, actively networks
Manages Complexity - Reasons from multiple perspectives, makes decisions
Achieves Results with Integrity - Conveys energy, focuses on results, acts with integrity
Innovates - Shows curiosity, imagines creative solutions, promotes team creativity
Demonstrates Entrepreneurship - Takes initiative, focuses on customers, improves business performance, develops a vision
Displays Sensitivity to the “Métier” of L’Oréal - Focuses on quality, builds knowledge of the beauty business, understands beauty
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other legally protected status. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete an application for a recognized disability under applicable law, please email [email protected]. Please note this email will only respond to specific requests for assistance completing the application as a request for accommodation for a disability. All others will not be considered. #DDIR

Company Description
TIDAL is a global music and entertainment streaming platform committed to creating a deeper connection between artists and fans through its library of more than 70 million songs, over 250,000 high quality videos, and available in over 60 countries. In addition, TIDAL offers its subscribers exclusive access to high-profile music and music videos, original content series, podcasts, documentaries, livestream concerts, tickets, merchandise and live experiences. Together, TIDAL and Square will be music-obsessed and artist-focused while we explore new artist tools, listener experiences, and access to financial systems that help artists be successful.

Job Description
We are in search of a Data Scientist who can help unlock a greater understanding of our customers and our platform. You will lead the development of various technical solutions that address the data and information needs for teams across the company, with a particular focus within the marketing organization.
You will become an integral part of TIDAL and will develop the core of our marketing analytics and customer understanding. Those solutions will help bring to light actionable insights to improve business decisions and provide better experiences for our customers. Our tech stack currently includes AWS, Spark, Redshift, Postgres, Airflow, Tableau, and Databricks. You will report to the Head of Analytics.

Qualifications
You Will:
Clarify loosely defined problems or business objectives across the marketing organization and devise useful metrics and technical solutions that support data-driven decision making
Partner with Data Engineering to implement analytics-specific data layers; this includes internal subscription and platform usage data, as well as enhancements from external vendors such as Google Analytics, Adjust, Braze, and other platforms in the marketing tech stack
Leverage latest methodologies in experimentation, modeling and statistical analysis to solve business problems, and translate findings into actionable recommendations
Partner with Head of Analytics and Data Engineering to modernize preexisting data processes and team best practices
Troubleshoot issues in data pipelines and reporting packages
Additional Information
You Have:
4+ years of experience in quantitative analytics, data science, and analytical consulting
Experience with analytical SQL; this role will work with an array of disparate data sources so experience writing efficient, performance-optimized queries is a must
Familiarity with a programming language typically used for statistical analysis and machine learning (preferably Python)
Hands-on experience with self-service analytics tools (e.g.Tableau, Looker)
Training in econometrics and statistics, with experience applying the relevant methodologies; a thorough understanding of statistical inference is required
Familiarity with marketing concepts such as user segmentation, customer journeys, user churn and lifetime value
We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Square is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.
Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.
Perks
We want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:
Healthcare coverage
Retirement Plans
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Wellness perks
Paid parental leave
Paid time off
Learning and Development resources
Square, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) builds tools to empower businesses and individuals to participate in the economy. Sellers use Square to reach buyers online and in person, manage their business, and access financing. Individuals use Cash App to spend, send, store, and invest money. And TIDAL is a global music and entertainment platform that expands Square's purpose of economic empowerment to artists. Square, Inc. has offices in the United States, Canada, Japan, Australia, Ireland, Spain, Norway, and the UK.

At FactSet, we're working to be the best financial data provider on earth. To get there, we need highly motivated, talented individuals who are empowered to find answers through creative technology.
As a Data Science Engineer in Content Engineering, you will be part of our Digital Transformation, a mission to automate our data acquisition, quality assurance, content creation and analytics in a scalable cloud environment. With the guidance of financial experts, you will leverage these large data sets to improve the quality and extend the scope of FactSet's existing and next generation products.
Responsibilities
Ingest and analyze various data sources to drive innovation in content creation.
Automate the acquisition, relevance scoring and storage of incoming sources.
Develop processes for data mining, data concordance and data production.
Explore and evaluate new data technologies to build a scalable, cloud oriented data platform.
Optimize data retrieval, develop dashboards and other visualizations for financial experts.
Essential Requirements
Bachelor's in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or related technical fields
2+ years of working experience in software development
Experience in data engineering or business intelligence or business analytics
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Desirable Requirements
Strong experience and proficiency with Python, Pandas, Numpy and AWS APIs
Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience with modern data platforms such as Spark, Hadoop or other map/reduce big data systems and services
Experience with a variety of data stores such as ArangoDB, MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase, DynamoDB
Experience with AWS environment e.g., Amazon Kinesis, AWS Glue, Redshift, EC2, S3, EMR
The budgeted amount range for this position in the State of Connecticut is $ 95,200 - $146,000
FactSet is an Equal Opportunity Employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

About the Opportunity
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer to join our team that operates as an internal project-based Business Intelligence team. In this role, you will leverage analytics to drive growth and efficiency as we enter the next phase of the company’s evolution. You will have the opportunity to solve challenging macro business problems, collaborate with cross functional teams, and have direct ownership in driving value across the organization.
In this role, you will:
Define and Develop Key Business Metrics. You’ll collaborate with business partners to define metrics for sales, membership, and revenue related initiatives; you will work with the central data organization in modeling and maintaining metrics derived.
Build and Manage Executive-Facing Dashboards. You’ll own compelling dashboards and automated reporting that will drive actionable insights to leadership and track progress towards our goals.
Serve as a Cross-Functional Data Subject Matter Expert. You’ll provide key research and analysis to track trends and support continued refinement of sales strategy.
About You
We’d love to hear from you if you meet the qualifications below:
Core competencies and technical skills:
Prior experience working in analytical capacity modeling, interpreting, and visualizing data (e.g. data analyst, data science, data engineer, consultant)
Highly skilled at writing and interpreting complex SQL queries
Experience building dashboards with a data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker)
Familiar with modern data stack, such as Airflow, Git, DBT, Docker
Ability to precisely and effectively communicate the results of your analyses directly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Possess an intuition for understanding underlying business needs and a knack for dealing with ambiguity
A degree with a quantitative focus (e.g. economics, statistics, engineering)
Nice to Haves:
Experience working with CRM (Salesforce, Hubspot, etc) software and data, or have worked on measuring sales performance indicators.
Knowledge of a scripting language (e.g. Python, R)
Prior experience in Sales Focused Roles, Analytics Consulting, or a Growth Stage company
Life at WeWork
Just as we empower our community, we believe in empowering our team to create their own life’s work. We move fast and challenge each other, but we always make sure we look out for one another. Our culture and values are what make working here rewarding. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Learn more about diversity at WeWork here.
As part of our commitment to health and safety, WeWork — like a growing number of employers — is requiring all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of employment, absent a legal exception for reasonable accommodation. We provide unvaccinated new hires a 45-day grace period after their start date to get fully vaccinated or, if eligible, obtain a reasonable accommodation. If you believe that a legal exception may apply to you, please still apply for any role(s) you are interested in and, if you are hired, you will receive instructions on how to request a reasonable accommodation after your start date. Please note that roles that require in-person work — currently, within our Community (excluding Member Experience), Facilities Management (including Security), Sales (excluding Sales Ops), and Member Technology teams — will not be eligible for work-from-home as an accommodation because it poses an undue hardship on our business.

Data/Analytics Engineer

About You:
We are looking for someone with data, systems, and analytics skills to join our small and growing team. This role will have you working cross functionally with internal stakeholders to help structure, automate, centralize, and optimize our business processes. This is a great opportunity for the right person to enhance their skill set across Data Engineering and Data Science - curiosity, creativity, and tenacious problem solving are a must!

Required Skills and Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in a hard science, mathematics, or engineering
2+ years of development experience with exposure to Data Science
Solid Python and SQL skills
Good knowledge of pandas with hands on data wrangling experience
Comfortable in the Linux environment
Solid math skills - Probability/statistics/calculus
Preferred Skills and Experience:
PhD/MSc
ETL/data pipelining experience
Experience with AWS services/EC2 and cloud storage
Data Science experience

COMPANY
Budweiser, Bud Light. Stella Artois. Michelob ULTRA. That’s right, over 100 of America’s most loved brands, to be exact. But there’s so much more to us than our top-notch portfolio of beers, seltzers, and more. We believe our people are our greatest asset, and we’re looking for people like you to join our shared dream. We dream big to create a future with more cheers. Are you up for the Challenge?
ROLE SUMMARY
“BeerTech” is a new function inside Anheuser-Busch, which operates like a startup. BeerTech is responsible for building digital products that are a competitive advantage to our business and comprises three technical guilds (Data Engineering, Data Science, Software Engineering) which support our Product Office.
In this role, you will work at the intersection of understanding business problems so that you can build data assets to support products that invoke people to take data driven decisions. This will entail developing a deep understanding of existing processes and the data that supports them. Through high frequency iterations and the use of best-in-class technologies, you will create and maintain data pipelines to support business needs. You will also have the opportunity to influence architecture and technology to promote the quality and innovation necessary for industry changing data driven decisions at all levels of the company.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Meaningfully relate data for key products across the company
Daily interactions with Business and Data Science teams to iterate quickly using Agile development methodology
Learn new technologies in order to utilize the best platforms available
Build data models using the latest cloud technologies that support fast, low maintenance and scalable problem solving
Create sustainable pipelines and support Data Science and the Front End team on all data needs

Job Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, or related engineering field
Relevant real-world experience developing scalable data assets
Experience writing efficient SQL queries
Experience in building data models on cloud technology
Experience with Agile ways of working to accelerate iteration cycles

Technology Skills
SQL
Snowflake
Google Cloud Platform
Azure DevOps
Data Pipeline
Data Modeling

Extra Credit
Treasure Data
Python

WHY ANHEUSER-BUSCH
Anheuser-Busch is here for the times that matter. The moments where we celebrate, defy challenges, dream of the brighter future we are building today– and all the moments in between. We are a company that brings people together for richer conversations, stronger communities and a future with more cheers!
Challenge Accepted! Apply Today!
BENEFITS
Health benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, Wellness and Tax-Advantaged Savings and Spending Accounts
Life Insurance and Disability Income Protection
Generous Parental Leave and FMLA policies
401(k) Retirement Savings options with a company matching contribution
Chance to work in a fast-paced environment among a company of owners
Free Beer!

As the leading global brewer, Anheuser-Busch InBev is committed to finding innovative ways to continually improve. It's this kind of thinking that creates a unique work environment by rewarding talent, celebrating diversity, and encouraging forward thinking. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Overview of the Position:
Data Science Instructors are the backbones of the organization and play a critically important role in providing quality educational services to Bootcamp students, corporate trainees and students of avocational data science courses. Full-Time Data Science Instructors need to have strong machine learning backgrounds and industry experience. Full-Time Data Science Instructors are assigned teaching and non-teaching responsibilities based on the needs of the Academy. The key job responsibilities listed below are for typical full-time Data Science Instructors who do not hold administrative titles.


Key Job Responsibilities:
Embrace the mission and vision of NYC Data Science Academy and fulfill the position responsibilities with dedication and efforts for excellence.Review Bootcamp curricular materials for a comprehensive knowledge and understanding of the curriculum structure and how each curricular component fits into the overall curriculum.Study the special areas of focus in the curriculum to gain full mastery of instructional materials for effective instructional delivery.Develop personal lesson plans for assigned portions of curriculum for effective instructional delivery and assessment of student learning.Conduct on an average nine (9) hours of classroom instruction per week in the residential data science Bootcamp, including instruction when necessary in corporate training and stand-alone avocational courses.Do green screen recording when necessary to generate curriculum materials for use with e-learning and/or Interactive Distance Learning courses.Participate in corporate consulting and special projects to help the Academy engage in partnership with business entities.Read printed and electronic literature in the data science discipline to keep current with trends in the field.Present one research report per quarter to a faculty meeting on chosen topics of interest in the data science discipline.Seek opportunities for presentation at professional data science conferences and meet-up sessions.Write one blog per quarter to help promote data science Bootcamp program, corporate training courses or stand-alone avocational courses.Provide guidance to Bootcamp students on their required projects and/or their respective learning challenges.Evaluate student projects and project presentations to provide constructive feedback to students.Perform quality assurance work on Bootcamp curricular materials and provide feedback to the Bootcamp Manager and the Curriculum Review Committee.Attend and participate in regular faculty meetings.Attend and participate in faculty in-service training sessions on instructional methodology, classroom management strategies, and strategies for assessing student learning.Participate in school events aimed at promoting the Academy’s programs and training courses.Perform other work-related tasks assigned by the immediate supervisor or as dictated by the situation.


Position Requirements:
Holds at least a bachelor’s degree or higher credential from an accredited institution of higher learning (Master’s and Doctoral Degrees highly desirable) and has specialized in data science
field through either training or work experience.
Has strong machine learning background.Has experience in one or more areas of data science through industry-related data science projects or working on data science projects in an industry.Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills.Strength in critical thinking and problem-solving and able to work independently.


Benefits
Competitive salary, adjustable hours, and flexible vacation policy.Benefits include 401k retirement plan and medical, dental, vision insurances.Opportunity to train, research, and learn in the field of data science on-the-job; a chance to interact with active data science communities through conferences, Meetup events, etc.Completely stocked snack pantry.High-quality computational equipment.

The STAR Health Center (SHC) at Brookdale Hospital Medical Center is a comprehensive ambulatory care program caring for the most vulnerable populations in Brooklyn, including people with HIV and HCV, immigrants, and LGBTQ+ populations, and people with mental health and substance use disorders. Duties: The eD2C Patient Navigator will assess HIV clients’ barriers to care and reasons for falling out of care; develop and implement tailored plans to engage and retain PWH clients in care; assist patients in obtaining needed services, housing, transportation, and referrals to CBOs for other services; assist with applications for Medicaid, ADAP, medication assistance programs and other benefits; refer for mental health and substance use issues engage partners in prevention education/PrEP; provide appointment reminders, ongoing education and support via phone, text or videoconferencing; refer to the rapid iART case manager and/or Care Coordination team for intensive medical case management/DOT; maintain communication with the health care team; participate in case conferences; maintain collaboration with community-based providers and participate in interagency case conferences; and participate in performance improvement processes. Qualifications: High school diploma/equivalent; with 2 years’ experience providing health education or case management services in a health care or social service agency; some college preferred. Experience with underserved populations such as people living with HIV/HCV, LGBTQ, and those with mental health and substance use disorders strongly preferred. Certified Application Counselor (CAC) credential required, but may be obtained upon hire. Training in Motivational Interviewing, ARTAS and Trauma Informed Care also required, but may be completed upon hire. Bilingual English/Spanish or English/Haitian Creole preferred. Hours: Full time, Monday-Friday. Salary Range: $50,000-55,000 per year. To apply, submit cover letter and resume to Alexis Fields, MPH, Program Manager, STAR Health Center–Brookdale, afields@bhmcny.org

Data Analyst, Enhanced Data-to-Care (eD2C) Project – One Brooklyn Health, Brookdale Hospital Medical Center, Brooklyn, NY
The STAR Health Center at Brookdale Hospital Medical Center is a comprehensive ambulatory care program caring for the most vulnerable populations in Brooklyn, including people with HIV and HCV, immigrants, LGBTQ and gender nonconforming populations, and people with mental health and substance use disorders. We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst for our newly funded Enhanced Data-to-Care (eD2C) Project to work closely with NYC Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) in the development of a system for collection and integration of data from multiple sources to identify individuals who are out of care in Brooklyn. Duties: Create operational workflow and documentation related to data entry, data cleaning and report building. Analyze and implement new, data collection, entry, and maintenance system for collection of all programmatic data required for extramurally funded programs. Conduct database query and data matches with DOHMH to identify individuals in the community who are out of care. Establish clinic data systems and workflow that identify clients determined to be out of care or at risk of falling out of care using internal and external data sources. Combine and reconcile data from disparate data sources (i.e., EHR, eSHARE, NYCDOHMH) for clinical and data management reporting and quality assurance activities. Provide database assistance to new STAR Program projects, as needed, including form design, structure, tracking, cleaning, reporting. Generate standard and ad hoc reports for funders and STAR staff and participate in generating annual report for Ryan White projects. Participate in routine case conferencing to facilitate discussions on the successes of program and opportunities for improvement. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in data science, public health, statistic, computer science, computer engineering, or IT-related fields such as business analytics, medical informatics or information systems. At least 3 years of experience in data management, reporting, analysis and quality assurance activities for clinical or research projects in a health care setting. Hours: Full-time, Monday-Friday, 9:00am to 5:00pm, 37.5 hours per week. Salary Range: $60,000-70,000 per year. To apply, submit cover letter, resume and salary requirements to: Alexis Fields, MPH, Program Manager, STAR Health Center – Brookdale, The Brookdale Hospital Medical Center, One Brookdale Plaza, Brooklyn, NY, 11212, afields@bhmcny.org

Duration: 4+ months

Or, they should have some Python training and at least have experience with other procedural language of similar or higher complexity such as Java, Scala, etc.Snowflake DB: Experience with the Snowflake DB is a plus.Apache Airflow: The candidate Should Have experience with an ETL Orchestration tool. Airflow experience is preferred, but experience with another ETL orchestration tool of similar or equal complexity such as NiFi would work as well.AWS: Candidate Should Have experience with AWS (and products such as Spark).Github: Experience with Github is a plus- or, experience could be with a similar version control tool such as Bitbucket.Jira: Experience with Jira is a plus- or, experience could be with a similar Agile development life cycle too such as VersionOne or Rally

As part of the Financial Reporting Quality Assurance Organization (FRQA) within Corporate Controllership, this role is responsible from bringing and managing data under governance for Finance.

Finance Data Governance (FDG) team is leading the effort of defining the future roadmap for data governance within Finance. This director leads a team of professionals focused on ensuring that trusted information is used for critical processes, decision making and accounting/reporting across various finance processes. The team is responsible for validating Source Data from various AXP Systems, ensuring accuracy and completeness of data.
The FDG Director is a collaborator, a well-organized, action-oriented individual with exceptional leadership and time management skills, confident in presenting, facilitating, and building a network of strong relationships across our organization.

Responsibilities
Strategic thought partnership with the Enterprise Data Governance team to bring under governance for the enterprise
Establish Finance Data Governance implementation roadmap including strategic priorities
Implementing requirements of the Enterprise Data Governance Policy within various critical Finance systems/processes
Serve as a liaison between Business/Functional areas and Technology to ensure that data related business requirements for governing critical data are clearly defined, communicated, and well understood/considered as part of operational prioritization and planning
Define roles and responsibilities related to finance data governance and ensure clear accountability for stewardship of the finance systems
Advancing the Data Governance Strategy for the Finance Data Management initiative. This initiative involves utilizing new technologies to create one standardized data set that can be utilized for broader Finance thus minimizing multiple point solutions, data duplication and reconciliation over time among other benefits
Leading a team of professionals with a focus on continuing to develop fintech skillsets for the future
Managing and responding to requests from Regulators on an as-needed basis

Qualifications
Finance/Accounting or Master’s degree in Data Science or Data Governance
8+ years of work experience in Banking/Financial Services
Knowledge of data governance practices, business and technology issues related to management of enterprise information assets
Knowledge of data related government regulatory requirements and emerging trends and issues
Proven people leadership experience and ability to attract, engage and retain high caliber global talent
Demonstrated working knowledge of Agile methodology and delivery concepts or other project management methodologies.
Strong relationship management and conflict resolution skills with a proven track of positively collaborating, influencing, and extensively coordinating with internal and external partners
Excellent written and verbal communications with ability to communicate highly complex concepts and processes in simple terms and pragmatically across Finance, Business and Technology stakeholders
Ability to be flexible, prioritize multiple demands, and effectively manage in a matrix organization
Ability to think strategically
Knowledge of financial and regulatory reporting is a plus

Senior Product Manager
E-Commerce, Internet
$170,000 - 190,000 Base + Stock
New York, NY

A leading e-commerce and internet company that has proven itself to be a mainstay with its subscription-based model is looking for an ambitious Data Product professional to join its team. Proficient experience in project management background with solid experience in data science and can ultimately work cross-functionally and articulate trend analysis to both technical and non-technical audiences.

As Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for taking charge of all data offerings and opportunities. Furthermore, you will ultimately build the strategy and own the release of product offerings, working cross-functionally with multiple teams, executive stakeholders, and brand partners.
The Senior Product Manager will work to develop the company product strategy, own the data product roadmap, and manage the full life-cycle for new data features and products. You will also partner closely with the data science team to deliver high-value data products and quality tracking solutions for the applications that are built on their platform.
As a Senior Product Manager you will be responsible for:

identify what the opportunities are, scope the problems, and work cross-functionally with data scientists and engineers

Build analytical models and research products. Improve research methodology. Drive new biz growth.

CB Insights is looking for a Quantitative Research Analyst to work closely with our research, data science, and product teams to develop analytical models and research products, improve the actionability of our research, and scale research output.

The role you'll play:

CB Insights is in the process of revamping its research portfolio - introducing new research products to the market and rebooting older ones.

As a Quantitative Research Analyst, you will play a key role in (a) building quantitative models to accompany our research products and (b) standardize methodology across teams and products. Further, you will be (c) tasked with automating research tasks, in effort to broaden and scale our research output.

You will work directly with the Senior Director of Research Products, a seasoned professional with nearly a decade of experience in developing research products and analytical models. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with other members of our product, data science, and research teams.

About the team:

If you want to increase growth, both for the business and professionally, then this is the place for you. The Research Products team is a new division within CB Insights, focusing on bringing new research products to market, along with scaling existing research products.

Your main tasks:

Translate research requirements into analytical models
Support research analysts by building tools to compress due diligence time and product maintenance efforts
Build scripts in order to load data into models, generate reports, and automate manual tasks for our research team
Evaluate our current research portfolio, products, and datasets, and suggest improvements around standardization
Identify new ways to pull valuable insights from raw data by introducing new metrics, new groups/cuts to monitor, and new visualization approaches
Write SQL queries to examine datasets and investigate specific corner cases
Structure data effectively in data warehouses with future-proofed schemas
Create dataframes representing key takeaways for translation into visualizations
Automate processes to enable 100x scaling

What you bring to the table:

B. Eng; BA / BS in Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, or Economics
1-2 years of experience in a quantitative / research role
Strong analytical and modeling skills
Experience working with and analyzing large datasets
Ability to multitask and work independently
Careful attention to detail, critical-thinker, problem-solver, and fast learner
Clear communication skills, able to analyze and explain a problem effectively and efficiently
Experience with MS Office apps and Google apps
Exposure to scripting (e.g. SQL, Python)
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, PowerBI)
5H's: Hard Work, High Standards, Hunger, Helpful and Humility

What's CB Insights All About

The CB Insights platform is the smartest way to explore and exploit emerging technologies. We help the world's leading companies accelerate their digital strategy and transformation with data, not opinion. Our Emerging Technology Insights Platform fuses machine and human intelligence to help you discover and manage your response to emerging technology startups and markets.

The Perks:

Amazing culture that emphasizes Hard Work, High Standards, Hunger, Helpfulness, and Humility. Learn more here
A newsletter that 700k+ people follow: Sign up here.
Be Healthy: Health with HSA and FSA options, dental, and vision insurance along with unlimited/take what you need sick day policy
Plan for the future: 401k with up to 4% match
Continued Learning: $1,000 yearly continuing education stipend
Rest and Relax: Competitive vacation and holiday plans
Refuel: In-office daily lunch stipend, unlimited snacks/coffee

We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking. We are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply if your experience is close to what we are looking for.

Equal Opportunity Employer: CB Insights is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

submit here and you'll be eligible for $5,000!

JobTitle: Associate Manager, Corporate Affairs - Public Policy Develop...
Content_text:
Auto req ID: 255725BR

Job Description
This position will assist in analysis of the impact of regulation, tax, policies, and commitments on the business, and will assist the Public Policy Development team in the creation of public policy risk scanning, guidance, and processes.

The PPD team is a part of central of excellence (COE) group to support global Government Affairs to establish PepsiCo’s public policy agenda and drive the development of strong policy positions. Collaborating with business units and Government Affairs to shape global public policy issues, PPD delivers competitive strength to the company and supports continued progress against PepsiCo's Winning with Purpose and Sustainability goals.

The role will assist in collecting and analyzing policy and financial data through tools like CRM, IRA and Global data, designing models to track global regulation risks in the areas of discriminatory sugar tax, plastic package, channel sales, labelling and advertising and marketing restriction, and partnering with sustainability and plastic package team to develop metrics to track performance for packaging initiatives, assess compliance cost and risks for environmental regulations

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Global Public Policy Development, Data and Analytics, based in Purchase, New York.

Accountabilities
Assists in the running of annual review processes for policy risks globally.
Assists in data gathering and processing for analysis of specific legislative and tax challenges, e.g. labelling, advertising and marketing, beverage taxes, etc.
Assists in the creation of economic and data-based models. For instance, models to estimate the impact of new legislation on the PepsiCo business, to estimate PepsiCo’s contributions to different economies, etc
Ability to create replicable processes for recurring projects with excellent documentation of how the process works
Ability to create process tracking documents to make it clear how far the project has progressed
Qualifications/Requirements
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree
8 years experience in data analysis and/or financial roles
Familiarity with financial analysis and quantitative methods
Strong familiarity with gathering, cleaning, and analyzing data.
Python, and be familiar with other data science tools (e.g. Tableau, Excel)
Strong communication skills to manage information gathering requests
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to translate analytical findings into actionable solutions and processes
Well-organized with strong attention to detail while working in a dynamic fast-paced environment
Ability to work collaboratively across functions, including comfort with supporting and interacting with senior executives
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with government or public affairs preferred
Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation
Job Type: Regular

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity
